O Sr. Carlos de 34 anos de idade, é casado e tem 5 filhos dos quais 4 estão a frequentar a escola no ensino primário e secundário e a outra é ainda muito nova para frequentar a escola. Ele é operário agrícola numa empresa de produção de bananas.
O presente empréstimo será aplicado na compra de material de construção (cimento, barrotes, janelas, aros, ferro e pedra) para dar continuidade a sua casa.
texts.en:
Carlos is 34 years old and married. He has five children, four of whom attend elementary school and the other daughter is still too young to go to school. He's a farm worker for a banana company.
The current loan wil be used to purchase construction supplies (cement, beams, window frames, iron and rocks) in order to continue building his house.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (cement, beams, window frames, iron and rocks) in order to continue building his house.

loans.name: Leopoldina

texts.pt:
A Sra. Leopoldina de 31 anos de idade, é solteira e vive em casa própria com os seus 3 filhos, todos a frequentar a escola no ensino primário. Ela é operária agrícola numa empresa de produção de banana.
Com o presente empréstimo irá comprar material de construção (cimento, chapas, uma porta, barrotes e pagamento de mão-de-obra ) para dar continuidade à construção de sua casa.
texts.en:
Leopoldina is 31 years old and single. She lives with her three children in a house that she owns. All her children attend elementary school. She's a farm worker for a banana company.
With the current loan she'll purchase construction supplies (cement, metal sheets, a door and beams) and pay for labor in order to continue building her house.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (cement, metal sheets, a door and beams) and to pay for labor in order to continue building her house.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La Sra. Maria es separada, tiene una hija, es comerciante, se dedica al macate (venta en forma ambulante) por la zona de Formosa -  Argentina hace más de 12 años.
Maria además de sus ventas también tiene una pequeña despensa en la que trabaja, y de esa forma y poder medio de sus trabajos está ayudando a su familia y está saliendo adelante.
Maria solicita de este crédito para la compra de prendas para sus ventas ambulantes y también insumos para su despensa, como ser comestibles, bebidas, y demás productos.
texts.en:
María's separated and has a daughter.  She's a merchant who has earned a living for more than 12 years selling merchandise as a street vendor in the area of Formosa, Argentina.  In addition to her sales, María also has a small grocery store where she works.  With these jobs she's helping her family and getting ahead.

María's requesting this loan to buy items to sell as well as supplies for her store such as food, beverages, and other products.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es: Marisol, a sus 41 años de edad es casada y madre de 4 hijos. Siempre se ha dedicado a ser ama de casa, pero, por las dificultades económicas por las que atraviesa su familia, decide iniciar su propio negocio y quiere montar una sala de internet, con el fin de generar ingresos para aportar al sostenimiento de su familia. Ella es  una señora emprendedora, activa, consciente de la realidad tecnológica que mueve al mundo y tiene muchas ganas de sacar adelante a su familia. Por esta razón solicita el apoyo del crédito para que su idea de negocio salga a flote, éste lo invertirá en la compra de equipos de trabajo (2 computadores, 1 impresora, sillas) y sacará publicidad (volantes) para poder iniciar su negocio y que le permita generar los recursos necesarios para tener una estabilidad económica en su hogar. Marisol, sueña con hacer crecer su negocio, que le permita en un futuro cercano brindar oportunidades de empleo y ampliar su portafolio de servicios, así mejorará la calidad de vida de su familia y podrá brindarle una excelente educación a todos sus hijos.
texts.en:
Marisol, 41, is married and mother of four children. She’s always been a housewife but because of the economic difficulties the family is going through, she’s decided to start her own business.  She wants to set up an Internet access service in order to earn income to contribute to family support.  She’s an enterprising, active woman who is aware of the technological reality that moves the world and she very much wants to move her family forward.

Because of this she requests a loan so that her business idea can take off.  She will use it to buy work equipment (2 computers, a printer and chairs) and will pay for publicity (flyers) to be able to start her business that will make it possible for her to generate the resources needed to have economic stability at home.

Marisol dreams with making her business grow so that in the near future she can offer employment opportunities and expand her range of services thus improving her family’s quality of life and be able to provide an excellent education to all her children.

loans.use: to buy equipment and pay for publicity.

loans.name: Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Esperanza está en su ciclo número veintiuno del programa de comité, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Es un grupo bastante unido que en los ciclos han aprendido a ayudarse las unas a las otras. Las mismas son reconocidas en el lugar como mujeres muy trabajadoras.
Evarista es parte de este grupo, ella trabaja en la venta de prendas y de lencería, tiene todo tipo y modelos y es eso lo que gusta a los clientes, y por lo que le esta yendo muy bien. Hoy ya es muy conocida por el esfuerzo que hace y por las ganas de salir adelante que demuestra.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas de invierno para poder surtirse y de esa forma poder seguir ofreciendo buena variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Esperanza Group is in its twenty-first loan cycle in the communal bank, in which they all work and help each other get ahead.  It's a pretty close group that has learned to help each other mutually in the loan cycles.  They're known in the area as very hardworking women.

Evarista's part of this group.  She works selling clothing and lingerie.  She has all types and models, which is what her customers like.  This is why it's going very well for her.  Today she's very well known for her effort and for her demonstrated desire to get ahead.

She's requesting this loan to be able to stock up on winter clothing so she can continue offering her customers a variety.

loans.use: to buy winter clothing

loans.name: Diana Patricia

texts.es: Diana a sus 22 años de edad es madre soltera de un hijo de 5 años. Actualmente se dedica a laborar como operaria en un cultivo de flores; pero por la necesidad de generar más ingresos mensuales para el sustento de su familia, ella desea iniciar su propio negocio, una venta de mercancía como camisas, camisetas, jeans, accesorios, para adultos y niños, con esto logrará generar más recursos para satisfacer las necesidades de su hogar ya que toda la carga económica recae sobre ella por ser madre soltera. Esta actividad la aprendió de su madre ya que ella también vende este tipo de mercancía. Con su visión emprendedora, con esfuerzo y mucha dedicación, Diana siempre va en busca de opciones que le permitan progresar, por ese motivo solicita el crédito, que será invertido en la compra de mercancía al por mayor (blusas, jeans, camisetas, camisas, entre otros) para aprovechar el descuento que realizan por compras de contado y con el fin de tener gran variedad disponible para ofrecer a los clientes del sector donde reside y sus alrededores, esto le permitirá venderlos a un mejor precio y así tener mayor utilidad por ventas, esto le ayudará a Diana a avanzar hacia el cumplimiento de su principal sueño, que es conseguir su casa propia para ofrecerle a su hijo un mejor bienestar y calidad de vida y una excelente educación para que tenga un futuro próspero y exitoso.
texts.en:
Diana, 22, is a single mother of a 5-year-old son.  She’s currently employed on a flower farm but she needs to generate more monthly income to support her family.  She wants to start her own business: selling merchandise like shirts, t-shirts, jeans and accessories for adults and children.  With this she’ll earn more resources to meet her household needs because being a single mother the entire economic load falls on her.

She learned this activity from her mother since she too sells this type of merchandise.  With her enterprising vision, effort and much dedication Diana is always seeking options that will make progress possible which is why she’s requesting this loan to buy merchandise (blouses, jeans, t-shirts, shirts, etc.) at wholesale so she can take advantage of discounts made available for cash purchases and so she can have a great variety of goods on-hand to offer customers in the sector where she resides and its surrounding areas.  

This will allow her to sell them at a better price thus earning higher sales profits and this will help Diana to advance towards making her main dream a reality: to get a house of her own to offer her son better well-being and quality of life and an excellent education so he’ll have a prosperous, successful future.

loans.use: to buy merchandise at wholesale.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen, age 36, is married and a vigorous lady. She is a hardworking mother of four who is helping her family by providing services of tailoring in her community. She has been doing this for the past six years. 

She very well knows the techniques of stitching clothes according to fashion. Her customers are satisfied with her services, and she earns enough income to lead a decent life. To help her continue operations of her business, she requested a loan of Rs. 20,000 to buy a stock of thread in different colors with some packs of zippers, buttons and elastic, to meet up with the increasing demand. 

Nasreen is in her fifth loan cycle with a good loan history. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy a stock of thread in different colors, with some packs of zippers, buttons and elastic.

loans.name: Laurinda

texts.pt:
A Sra. Laurinda de 58 anos de idade, é solteira e tem dois filhos que estão a viver na África do Sul. Tem como dependentes 2 sobrinhos. Ela é negociante há mais de 10 anos e vende diversos produtos nos mercados de Boane e Maputo, produtos estes que saem da sua própria machamba.
O presente empréstimo será aplicado para compra de material de construção (cimento, ferro, pagamento de transporte e mão-de-obra) para dar continuidade à construção da sua casa.
Tem como esperança terminar a construção da sua casa e comprar os respectivos móveis, tudo com empréstimos da Hluvuku-Adsema.
texts.en:
Laurinda is 58 years old and single. She has two children who currently live in South Africa. She has two nephews who depend on her. She has been a businesswoman for over 10 years and sells various products in the markets of Boane and Maputo. The products come from her own farm.
The current loan will be used to purchase construction supplies (cement and iron) and to pay for transportation and labor in order to continue building her house.
Her hope is to finish building her house and buy the furniture for it, all with loans from Hluvuku-Adsema.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (cement and iron) and to pay for transportation and labor in order to continue building her house.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a firewood vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy additional firewood to sell.

Lorna has been in this business for 20 years. She earns more income from a general store.

Lorna has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional firewood to sell.

loans.name: Villa 23 De Octubre Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado 23 de octubre  está en su Quinto ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, todas ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 3 de las 16 señoras se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, pero todas ellas están esforzándose por ir mejorando el ingreso de cada una.
Maria, es una de ellas, quien vende bebidas de todo tipo, es una mujer muy trabajadora, que desde muy joven tuvo que salir a trabajar y de esa forma luchar. Comenta también que los fines de semana es cuando más ventas tiene y es gracias a eso que le está yendo mejor. Quiere seguir creciendo en su trabajo es por eso que solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de bebidas, como ser gaseosas, jugos, cervezas vinos y demás.
texts.en:
The "Villa 23 de Octubre" Group is in their fifth cycle of the Woman's Works Council Program. All the members have completed the Poverty Stoplight survey. Three of the sixteen woman found themselves below the poverty line but they are all making an effort to increase the income of each other. 

One of them, Maria sells drinks of all kinds. She is a fighter who works very hard. She had to go out and work from an early age. She mentioned that weekends are busiest for her sales and thanks to this she is doing well. She wants to increase her business so she is asking for this loan so that she can buy drinks, like pop, juice, beer, wine etc.

loans.use: to buy pop, juice, beer, wine,etc.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Del Barrio San Pedro Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Luchadoras del Barrio San Pedro está en el  17º ciclo  del programa de comités de la fundacion paraguaya, todas ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, trabajando con su nuevo crédito en el aumento de sus ingresos, para que de esa forma vayan superando cualquier obstáculo que les impida ir creciendo.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Bety, ella es modista y trabaja en la confección de cortinados y colchas en general y  el crédito lo solicita para la compra de insumos para el taller de costuras, como ser tealas, hilos, gomas, etc. Ella en su última encuesta se encontraba con ingresos estables, pero de igual manera sigue muy entusiasmada invirtiendo el dinero del préstamo que realiza dentro del comité, lo que le ayuda a invertir en y a seguir mejorando sus ingresos y el de su familia.
También se debe destacar el trabajo de las asesoras, quienes hacen un seguimiento permanente de capacitaciones y verificaciones que de alguna manera exigen y al mismo tiempo incentivan a las mujeres a luchar para poder progresar continuamente.
texts.en:
The communal bank Mujeres Luchadoras del Barrio San Pedro is in its 17th loan cycle with Fundacion Paraguaya. The members are participating in the poverty elimination survey and working to increase their income with this loan so that they can overcome any obstacle to their growth. 

Bety, one of the members, is a seamstress who makes drapes and bedspreads. She will use this loan to buy fabric, thread, elastic, and other supplies for her tailoring shop. In the last survey, Bety showed stable income. Nevertheless, she is very excited about investing the institution's loan to keep increasing the income she and her family will earn. The counselors' efforts to continuously train the members, verify their work, and encourage them to strive for success is notable.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, elastic, and other supplies for a tailoring shop.

loans.name: Loma Poty Group

texts.es:
El grupo Loma Poty, se encuentra en el 1º ciclo, todas cuentan con su actividad comercial en distintos rubros, desean ir creciendo y contar siempre con el apoyo del programa de comité, para que por medio de las capacitaciones vayan mejorando.
La Sra. Norma es Docente, vive en casa propia con su marido e hijos,  es la presidenta del grupo, y ella trata de mantener motivado a sus integrantes para que siempre estén unidas y poder lograr alcanzar el objetivo de cada una con ayuda mutua y solidaridad.
La Sra. Solicita  este crédito para la compra de insumos de primera necesidad, como ser yerba, arroz, azúcar, aceite y demás,  y emprender la venta de productos varios en su comunidad, de esta manera generar una fuente de ingreso mas para su hogar.-
texts.en:
The "Loma Poty" bank group is in its 1st lending cycle. All of the members participate in their own distinct type of commercial activity. They want their businesses to grow, and to be able to always count on the support of the group program so that through their trainings they will improve their businesses. 

Norma is a teacher. She lives in her own home with her husband and children. She is the president of the group and she tries to keep her members motivated so that they will always be united and will achieve each of their goals with mutual assistance and solidarity. She is seeking this loan to buy basic necessities like herbs, rice, sugar, oil and more, and to learn how to sell various products in her community. This way she will generate an additional source of income for her household.

loans.use:
to buy herbs, rice, sugar, oil and more to 
start a new business.

loans.name: Las Marias Group

texts.es:
Las Marias es un grupo formado en la ciudad de Caacupé, ellas son mujeres jefas de familia, que están luchando por dar a sus hijos lo que ellas no pudieron tener.
La señora Irene es la presidenta del comité, ella solicita su crédito para invertirlo en la compra de arcillas y leñas para la fabricación de ladrillos, ya que a eso se dedica y es el sustento de su familia.
Ella es una mujer muy emprendedora, y por sobre todo muy trabajadora. Todas las integrantes agradecen por esta oportunidad que estan recibiendo que les será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Las Marias" was formed in the city of Caacupé.  These women are heads of households who are striving to give their children the things that they were not able to have.

Irene is the president of the group.  She is requesting a loan to invest in clay and firewood to make bricks, because she supports her family with this business.

Irene is very enterprising, and most of all, very hardworking.  All of the members of this group are grateful for the opportunity that they are receiving, which is going to be a great help to them.

loans.use: to buy clay and firewood

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
El comité surgió gracias a la promoción hecha a una de las integrantes. “kuña katupyry” fue denominado el comité y actualmente se encuentra en el 3º ciclo con 14 integrantes, cada una con su propio emprendimiento.
Isabel es comerciante, vente todo tipo de artículos, es una persona que innova, y siempre trae productos que llaman la atención a sus clientes. Trabaja duro y gracias a eso está saliendo adelante, sumado eso al gran carisma que tiene.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de remeras, camisas, pantalones, medias, para la venta, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo
texts.en:
This committee was formed thanks to the efforts of one of its members, and was named “Kuña Katupyry”. It is now in its third loan cycle and has 14 members, each of whom runs their own enterprise. Isabel is a businesswoman who sells all kinds of products. She is an innovative person who always finds items that catch her customers’ eyes. Isabel works hard, and this quality, along with her amazing charisma, has enabled her to get ahead
Isabel is applying for this loan to invest in the purchase of t-shirts, blouses, pants and stockings in order to continue her sales.

loans.use: to purchase t-shirts, blouses, pants, stockings, etc.

loans.name: Mujeres Al Poder Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres al Poder está en su ciclo número 9º del programa de comité de mujeres, donde ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 2 de ellas se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, luchando por mejorar sus ingresos, trabajar y así también poder ayudar a sus familias.
Maria cuenta que  tiene venta de comestibles, también se debe destacar el esfuerzo que ella hace, ya que todos los días empieza a trabajar desde muy tempranas horas, sacrificándose y de esa forma ir mejorando su vida. Ella es consciente que hay que luchar y trabajar duro por superar la pobreza.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de sus productos para la elaboración de sus alimentos tales como empanadas, croquetas entre otros, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
This group is called Women in Power and it is in it's 9th lending cycle as part of the women's program. These women are undertaking the task of eliminating poverty, two of them are below the poverty line and they are fighting to increase their earnings by working and through this they will be able to help their families.

Maria told us that she sells food. She highlighted the effort that she makes because every day she begins to work very early in the morning, making this sacrifice so that she can better her life. She is aware that she needs to struggle and work hard to overcome poverty. She is seeking this loan to buy products for the creation of her meals, such as empanadas and croquettes, among others which will allow her to solidify her business plan which will help her to increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy groceries including meat, vegetables, condiments and more.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Emprendedoras está en su primer ciclo del programa de comité, ellas están conociéndose y esforzándose, quieren poder trabajar juntas y están muy motivadas, hacen la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza para poder conocer la situación de cada una y conforme a ello ayudarlas.
La Sra. Mabel es una de ellas, quien es Vendedora de Bijouterie, que ella misma hace, es una persona muy creativa que hace todo tipo de creaciones. Gracias a lo bello que son los accesorios que hace, se ha hecho de muy buena clientela, que siempre quiere sus novedades.
La Sra Mabel solicita de este crédito para la compra de accesorios (canutillos, ganchos chico, medianos, alicate, hilos, ect)  lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos y seguir con sus ventas.
texts.en:
This group is called Women Entrepreneurs and it is in its first lending cycle in the program. The women are getting to know each other and working hard. They want to work together and they are very motivated. They are working on the task of eliminating poverty and learning about each other's situations and accordingly helping each other. 

Mabel is one of the members. She is a jewelry saleswoman. She sells jewelry that she makes. She is a very creative person who makes all types of items. Thanks to the beauty of the accessories that she makes, she has acquired a very good clientele who always want her new items. Mabel is seeking this loan to buy supplies (beads, guy hooks, clasps, pliers, wire, etc.) which will help her to solidify her business plan and will help her to increase her profits and to continue her sales.

loans.use: to buy beads, guy hooks, pliers, clasps, wire, etc.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is 25 years old and married. She resides in Kapalaran, Tambulig, Philippines. Janeth owns and operates farm land. She plants and harvests rice as well as bananas and vegetables for a living and has been in this business for more than five years. Each month, she earns 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) doing this type of business. Aside from farming, she also has a general store selling grocery items in her community to generate more income for the family.

In 2010, Janeth joined GDMPC. Janeth requested a new loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers and to cover the labor costs of farm maintenance. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and to cover the labor costs of farm maintenance.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 27-year-old Josephine from Kandeh town, Bo, in the southern area of Freetown. She is single with one child who is nine years old. 

Josephine runs a cookery business. She sells cooked rice, fried fish and cool drinks. She has been running this business for two years. She wakes up at 4:30 am to prepare her cookery business. She will not rest until the food is finished. Her business is the only source of income she has. Josephine describes her major hardship as insufficient capital to run her business.  

Josephine has requested a loan in order to purchase cooking items including rice, coconut oil, soft drinks and pure water. The extra income from this loan will allow her to change her cookery structure and repay her loan. In the future, she plans to have her own restaurant. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase cooking ingredients including rice, coconut oil, soft drinks and pure water.

loans.name: Yoayu Group

texts.es:
El comité llamado “Yoayu”  está en su ciclo número 5º del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante., asisten a las capacitaciones y así cada vez van mejorando más.
Regina es parte de este grupo, ella es una mujer muy sacrificada, que se dedica a la recolección de materiales reciclables, en forma ambulante, también los compra y luego revende a mejor precio para tener un poco mas de ganancias. Ella cuenta que está orgullosa de lo que hace que es un trabajo signo y honesto.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de plásticos, cartones y demás insumos que revenderá y podrá tener una ganancia extra.
texts.en:
The “Yoayu”  Group communal bank is in their fifth cycle of the Women's Works Council program. The members all work and help each other to get ahead, attending the training sessions and through this continually improving their situations.
Regina is a member of the group. a very unselfish woman, who works collecting recyclable materials in the streets. She also buys and re-sells these materials to create some more income. She states that she is proud of what she does as it is honest and dignified work. Regina is asking for this loan to buy plastic, boxes and other materials that she will re-sell and create some more revenue.

loans.use: to buy plastics, boxes and other materials to re-sell.

loans.name: Vat's Group

texts.en: Vat is a resident from Sa Ang district of Kandal province. He is 39 years old.  He is a parent of one dependent daughter who is in school. His main source of income is from rice farming with the support of his wife. During his spare time, he drives a motor-taxi for additional income. He has been with his current business for 14 years, earning about 14,000 KHR per day. Vat has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for the past three cycles long ago and has repaid back his loan completely. His prior loans have supported his business on time and earned him a decent income to keep his daughter in school. For this cycle, he formed a group of three to apply for a new loan. As the leader, he will spend his loan portion to buy potash for his farmland. He hopes to increase his income from his agribusiness.

loans.use: To buy potash for her farmland

loans.name: Sila

texts.en:
Sila is 20 years old and single. He supports his two young brothers. Sila hawks green tea leaves in Chemundu. Kapsabet and has been doing this for the last two years. From this business, he gets a monthly income of KES 7,500.

He has borrowed a loan of KES 70,000, which he will use to purchase more green tea leaves for resale. With the anticipated profits, he will pay his siblings school fees and expand his business.

His dream is to have a better living standard and to give the best education possible to his siblings.

loans.use: To purchase green tea leaves

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosalie is 38 years old and has two children who are in school.

Rosalie has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. Rosalie requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials and equipment for her business.

Rosalie has been in this business for four years. Rosalie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and equipment for her business

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 31 years old and has four children. She is married and three of her children are in school. Ruth is in an agricultural business buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years now and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Ruth requested a 16,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to sell. In the future, Ruth would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Arlaine

texts.en:
This is Arlaine, 31, a resident of Intramuros, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Richard, her business partner, and a mother to her child. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Arlaine operates a gown and other ready-to-wear rental business. She buys gowns and offers them to others who would like to rent them on a daily basis. These gowns are used in special occasions and other formal gatherings. She also sells accessories for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 2,500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy wedding gowns, barong tagalog, mother dresses and other ready to wear products needed in her business.

Arlaine dreams of having her own store so she won’t have to pay rent anymore. She hopes to have a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for wedding gowns, barong tagalog, mother dresses and other ready to wear products

loans.name: Phorn's Group

texts.en: Fifty years old, and a villager from Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Phorn is married and blessed with six children. To make a living, he has rice crops on 10 hectares of land and grows corn on a five hectare plot. This is the work that he has been doing for 18 years. This is Phorn's fourth microloan with VisionFund (Kiva’ partner). He has fully repaid his past loans with success to sustain his business and improve his living conditions. Now, he has now formed a group with one other person, and he is a leader. Phorn is applying for 1,400,000 KHR, while his joint borrower is applying for 500,000 KHR. For Phorn, he will spend his loan portion to buy potash and good corn seed for his corn field. He hopes to grow his corn in timely manner and produce a high crop yield with a good selling price.

loans.use: to buy potash and good corn seed for her corn field.

loans.name: Las Amigas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Las Amigas esta integrado por vecinas y amigas de la ciudad de Luque, están en su ciclo número 14 del programa de comité, ellas están trabajando con la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, para conocer la situación de cada una, y conforme al resultado dirigir las capacitaciones.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Celia, quien vende prendas, por medio de su esfuerzo, sumado a su trabajo y a la habilidad para las ventas que tiene, está superando su pobreza. Ella está contenta de formar este grupo, ya que las distintas capacitaciones la ayudan mucho. Su sueño es poder tener una mayor capacidad para ofrecer gran variedad de prendas a sus clientes, y es en busca de este sueño que lucha.
La señora solicita de este crédito para la compra de prendas de invierno, ya que estamos en tiempos de frió, y de esa forma poder invertir en su plan de negocios.
texts.en:
The Las Amigas group is made of neighbors and friends from the city of Luque. They are in their 14th cycle of the program of the committee, and they are working with the survey of poverty elimination, in order to know the situation of every member, and direct trainings according to the results. 

One of the members is Celia, who sells clothes. Due to her efforts, her work, and her ability to make sales, she is overcoming her poverty. She is happy to be part of this group, since the different trainings help her a lot. Her dream is to have a better ability to offer a big variety of clothing for her customers, and she is in search of this dream that she is fighting for. 

She is requesting this loan in order to buy winter clothing, since we are in the cold weather season, and in this way to be able to invest in her business plan.

loans.use: to buy winter clothing to sell.

loans.name: Verginith

texts.en:
Verginith works hard to support her family. She is single and has a business raising pigs in the Philippines.

Verginith requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been in this business for 3 years now.

Verginith would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Tamam

texts.en:
Tamam is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears here in a photo taken while he was in his workshop.

Tamam is a 34-year-old married woman from Qalqilia. She is a mother of four children: two boys and two girls. All of them are under 18 and going to school. Tamam's husband works in a sewing workshop he owns. It has been operating for more than five years. This is the only source of income for the family. In the sewing workshop, they make kids' clothes and women's clothes and sell them in the local market. 

Tamam took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her husband to buy another sewing machine for his workshop. This will improve the quality of their production and also their income.

loans.use: to buy another sewing machine for her husband's workshop

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Nueva Esperanza está en su ciclo número 10 del programa de comité, donde cada una pone su mayor esfuerzo por ir mejorando su vida y la de sus familias, y que no tengan que pasar por privaciones como las que ellas tuvieron que pasar.
Editt es la presidenta de este grupo, es una mujer entusiasta que motiva siempre a sus amigas a ir trabajando duro por salir adelante. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, es empleada y también se dedica a la venta de lencerías. Es muy eficiente en lo que hace, y en cuanto a su venta de lencería ya tiene muy buena clientela.Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de lencería para hombres y mujeres, y de esa forma seguir con sus ventas y cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group called Nueva Esperanza [New Hope] is in its 10th cycle of the its loan schedule. All of the members give their best efforts to improve their lives and those of their families, and to not have to struggle on their own like they had to before. 

Editt is the president of the group. She is an enthusiastic woman who is always motivating her friends to work hard to get ahead. She is a very hard-working woman. She works as a housekeeper and also sells intimate apparel. She is very efficient in everything she does, and she has a very good clientele when it comes to her underwear business. 

She is seeking this loan to be able to invest in the purchase of underwear for men and women. In this way, she will be able to continue with her sales and satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to buy underwear for both men and women.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 47 years old and married with two children. With one child currently in school, Angelita works very hard to provide for them.

Angelita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.  She has been in this business for five years, and sells a variety of items such as milk, bread, candies, canned goods, cooking oil, etc. 

In the future, Angelita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
El comité Oñondivepa se formo con la unión de varias vecinas de la comunidad de la ciudad de Vya Renda de la ciudad de Santaní, una colonia bastante alejada de la zonza céntrica, y de muy difícil acceso. Es una zona eminente rural, donde todas las integrantes se dedican a la cría y venta de animales de corral.
Marcia, una de ellas, está contenta de formar parte del grupo, ya que podrá invertir y ayudar a su familia. Ella solicita de este crédito para la compra de balanceados para sus animales, y así seguir trabajando y ganándose el sustento.
texts.en:
The communal bank Oñondivepa was made by the joining of a group of neighbours from the community of Vya Renda, in the city of Santaní. This neighbourhood is fairly far from the city centre, and it is difficult to access. It is a prominent rural area, and all of the group members work raising and selling farm animals.

One of them, Marcia, is happy to be part of the group, since she will be able to invest and help her family. She is asking for this loan to buy animal feed, in order to continue working and earning a living.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is a 45-year-old fruit vendor from the community of Talibon, Bohol. She is married with two children, ages 2 and 15. 

She has been a fruit vendor for four years, selling fruits such as apples, oranges, mangos, and watermelon. She is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy more mangos and watermelon. This way, she will not run out of her supply of fruit. 

In the future, she hopes to have a bigger fruit stand and be able to expand her business for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy mangos and watermelon

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 37 years old, married, and has three children who are in school.  Lorna has a buy and sell dried coconut meat business in the Philippines; she is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  

Lorna requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell.

Lorna has been in this business for 17 years; in the future, Lorna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 42-year-old Fatmata from Mobria town Bo. She is married with three children between the ages of 11 and 24. Two of her children are currently attending school. 

Fatmata runs a general store business; she sells soft drinks, bread, cigarettes and eggs. She has been running this business for 15 years. She works at the business throughout the week, and 10 hours per day.  Fatmata says that at present, her business is doing well.

Fatmata has requested a loan in order to purchase soft drinks, bread, cigarettes, and eggs to sell. The extra income from this loan will allow her to pay her children's school fees, and increase her business. 

In the future, she plans to expand her enterprise even more. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, bread, cigarettes, and eggs to sell.

loans.name: Benkadi Ii Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe   BENKADI II   est constitué10 de femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 39  ans,  4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à   DISSAN, un des villages de BOUGOUNI, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles hivernale. 
Elles sont à leur  5éme prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
Le riz   est la spéculation cultivée de   KOROTOUMOU       la  3éme femme de la droite vers la gauche.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour exploiter  1hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village, au marché, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de  100 000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de rembourser son prêt et  d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de leur ménage.
texts.en:
The group "BENKADI II" is composed of ten married women, who average 39 years of age and four children each, all living in polygamous families in DISSAN, a village in BOUGOUNI (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their rainy season farm work. They are on their fifth loan with the institution. The past loans were indeed paid back.

Rice is the crop grown by KOROTOUMOU, who is the third woman from the right. With her loan, she intends to purchase farm inputs and seeds and to pay for plowing to make use of 1 hectare.

After the harvest, the produce is sold to men and women customers in the village, at the market. She plans on making a profit of 100,000 francs CFA per planting. The profit will enable her to pay back the loan and help her husband to cover the day-to-day expenses of their household.

loans.use: to pay for farm inputs and plowing for planting crops

loans.name: Benkadi Iii Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI III     est constitué 10   de femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de     38     ans, 4  enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  DISSAN, un des villages de BOUGOUNI, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles hivernale. 
Elles sont à leur 5éme  prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
Le riz  est la spéculation cultivée de   OUMOU      la 3éme femme  debout      de la droite  vers la  gauche.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour exploiter  2 hectares. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village, au marché, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de  120 000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de rembourser son prêt et  d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de leur ménage.
texts.en:
The group "BENKADI III" is composed of ten married women, who average 38 years of age and four children each, all living in polygamous families in DISSAN, a village in BOUGOUNI (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their rainy season farm work. They are on their fifth loan with the institution. The past loans were indeed paid back.

Rice is the crop grown by OUMOU, who standing third from the right. With her loan, she intends to purchase farm inputs and seeds and to pay for plowing to make use of 2 hectares.

After the harvest, the produce is sold to men and women customers in the village, at the market. She plans on making a profit of 120,000 francs CFA per planting. The profit will enable her to pay back the loan and help her husband to cover the day-to-day expenses of their household.

loans.use: to pay for farm inputs and plowing for planting crops

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam is a family man, age 28; he lives in a rural area.  He has a family of two children, one of whom is already in school.

Sam runs a retail shop at his trading center.  He is primarily involved in the bark cloth trade; he takes his goods at least weekly to the city. There is a lot of demand for the bark cloth because it can be used for making crafts and other purposes. He will buy more bark cloth with the loan.

He says he has managed to acquire a plot of land in his home area, plus educate his child through the sale of bark cloth.  He hopes the future is bright with his business now that he can access funds from Ugafode-kyotera branch.

Sam says he has acquired this facility to stock more bark cloths, and with the balance, he is going to acquire a motorcycle to facilitate gathering his merchandise from different areas.

Sam describes himself as an honest and hard-working man who has had a lot of achievements at a tender age; he thanks the institution for availing him with loans at a reduced interest rate.

In the photo, Sam is shown with the bark cloth.

loans.use: To buy local cloth that is used to make crafts.

loans.name: Benkadi Iv Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI IV    est de femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de     37     ans, 3  enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  DISSAN, un des villages de BOUGOUNI, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles hivernale. 
Elles sont à leur 5éme  prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
Le riz  est la spéculation cultivée de   AWA la 2éme femme  debout      de la gauche vers la droite.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour exploiter  2 hectares. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village, au marché, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de  120 000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de rembourser son prêt et  d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de leur ménage.
texts.en:
The group "BENKADI IV" is composed of married women, who average 37 years of age and three children each, all living in polygamous families in DISSAN, a village in BOUGOUNI (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their rainy season farm work. They are on their fifth loan with the institution. The past loans were indeed paid back.

Rice is the crop grown by AWA, who is standing second from the left. With her loan, she intends to purchase farm inputs and seeds and to pay for plowing to make use of 2 hectares.

After the harvest, the produce is sold to men and women customers in the village, at the market. She plans on making a profit of 120,000 francs CFA per planting. The profit will enable her to pay back the loan and help her husband to cover the day-to-day expenses of their household.

loans.use: to pay for farm inputs and plowing for planting crops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more sheep and feed

loans.name: Aysar

texts.en:
Aysar is a 22-year-old single man from a small village called Attel near Tulkarm.  He lives with his family in a small home in the village. 

Aysar works as a farmer on the family land; he plants seasonal fruits and vegetables and sells them in the local market.  He would like to live in his own home and be independent.

Aysar took a USD loan from FATEN; this loan will help him complete the building of his home, specifically adding windows and doors so it is ready to live in with his future wife. 

Aysar appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the costs of completing building his home, specifically adding windows and doors

loans.name: Ayao

texts.fr: père d'un enfant de 04ans, Ayao âgé de 32ans a pour conjointe une revendeuse. Ayant pour fonction un réparateur et vendeur d'appareil électroniques depuis 2008, il sollicite un premier crédit à WAGES pour s'approvisionner en marchandises afin de pouvoir répondre aux besoins de la famille. Il souhaite avoir un grand atelier et subvenir aux moindres besoins de la famille.
texts.en: A father of a 4-year-old child, Ayao is 32 years old, and his wife is a retailer. He has been working as a repairman and vendor of electronics since 2008. He is requesting an initial loan from WAGES to stock up on merchandise to be able to meet family needs. He would like to have a large workshop and to meet the smallest needs of the family.

loans.use: to purchase electronic items to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for 300 chicks, fodder, medicines, and tableware.

loans.name: Jorge Alveiro

texts.es: Jorge a sus 23 años de edad, es soltero y aún no tiene hijos. Por falta de oportunidades laborales, le ha sido difícil emplearse. Por esta razón y con el apoyo de su padre desea iniciar su propio negocio, planea montar una tienda de remates, con lo cual espera generar los ingresos para aportar al sustento de su hogar y de sus padres. Jorge es un joven emprendedor, trabajador y con proyección hacia el futuro, motivado por el apoyo que le brinda su padre y con las ganas de salir adelante, solicita el crédito que será invertido en la compra de activos fijos (mostradores, televisor, equipo, ventilador), compra de surtido (vajilla, electrodomésticos pequeños, papelería, juguetes) y realizará mejoras locativas (pintura, mejoras en el piso del local), con esto podrá darle inicio a la actividad que le generará ingresos suficientes para salir adelante y cumplir el sueño de hacer que su negocio sea rentable y perdurable en el tiempo, que le permita aportar a la economía de sus padres y mejorar la calidad de vida.
texts.en: Jorge, at 23 years old, is single and has no children. Due to a lack of job opportunities, it has been difficult for him to find employment. For this reason, and with his father's support, he wants to start his own business. He plans on setting up a discount store, from which he hopes to earn an income to contribute to supporting his home and his parents. Jorge, motivated by his father's support and a desire to get ahead, is a young entrepreneur and hard worker who looks towards the future. He is applying for this loan which will be used to to buy fixed assets (counters, a television, equipment, a fan) and stock (tableware, small electrical home appliances, stationery, toys), and also to make improvements in the rental space (painting, flooring improvements). With this loan, he will be able to start his activity which will earn him an adequate income to get ahead and fulfill his dream of making his business profitable and long-lasting, which will allow him to contribute to his parents' finances and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fixed assets (counters, a television, equipment, a fan) and stock (tableware, small electrical home appliances, stationery, toys), and also to make improvements in the rental space (painting, flooring improvements).

loans.name: Chanthy's Group

texts.en:
Chanthy is a 27-year-old married woman who lives in a rural village in the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province. She has one daughter who is still too young for school. Chanthy is a homemaker while her husband works as a paid worker in a rural area. Having been in this business for seven years, she is able to earn about 27,000KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.
Chanthy has been a member of Kiva’s partner VisionFund for two cycles already. She successfully used the previous loan to better support her family to have sufficient food. Now she and her group members are applying for another loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy household supplies for her family to use. She hopes to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy household supplies for her family to use

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Phalla's Group

texts.en:
Phalla is married and the mother of three children, one of whom is still in school. She is a resident of the Thmor Koul district in the Battambang province. It is the area where rice farming is a common business. 

As their primary source of income, Phalla manages six hectares of farmland for growing paddy rice. Phalla’s group is composed of two female members taking out the loan, and she is the group leader. She and the other group member are first-cycle clients with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. 

Phalla is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she will use her loan portion to buy five sacks of fertilizer and insecticide for her farmland. 

She hopes that her business will go well, as she expects to provide a high level of education to her children so they can have good jobs.

loans.use: To buy five sacks of fertilizer and insecticide for her farmland

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El señor Carlos vive acompañado de su mujer es de profesión mecánico y cuenta que desde chico trabajó en un taller mecánico por lo ya le gustaba esa profesión.
Fue así que con el trascurrir del tiempo alquiló un tinglado para poder trabajar a gran escala. Actualmente tiene un taller amplio para todo público sobre una ruta muy transitada. Es una persona que se esfuerza mucho y quiere salir adelante.
El préstamo que solicita lo quiere invertir para la compra de repuestos, pulidoras, prensa hidráulica y herramientas en general para obtener mayor comodidad en su taller.
texts.en:
Carlos is a mechanic and lives with his wife. He says that he has worked in a mechanic's workshop since he was a boy because he liked the profession. 

So after a time, he hired a shed to be able to work on a large scale. Currently he has a spacious workshop for the public on a very busy route. He is a person who puts in a lot of effort and wants to get ahead. 

He wants to invest the loan he is applying for in buying spare parts, polishers, a hydraulic press and general tools to make his workshop more suitable.

loans.use: to buy spare parts, polishers, a hydraulic press and tools

loans.name: Marelby Del Socorro

texts.es: Marelby, con 29 años de edad es soltera y no tiene hijos, vive con 2 abuelos y un hermano menor. Actualmente se dedica a laborar como auxiliar de enfermería, pero es una labor muy inestable ya que trabaja por contratos o por horas, esto le genera dificultades económicas en su hogar. Ella, con su actitud emprendedora, enérgica y positiva, desea iniciar su propio negocio, un puesto de comidas rápidas, donde trabajará los fines de semana de 5 de la tarde a 12 de la noche, con lo que espera obtener mejores ingresos para llevar el sustento a su hogar. Para que su idea de negocio funcione, solicita el crédito como un apoyo, para invertirlo en la compra de activos fijos (plancha, carro de perros, carpa, utensilios de cocina y nevera) por valor de $1.000.000 e insumos (carnes frías, panes, salsas, gaseosas) por valor de $500.000, de esta manera podrá ofrecerle a sus clientes variedad de productos que satisfagan sus gustos, con lo cual espera progresar y sacar adelante a su familia. Marelby sueña con hacer crecer su negocio, montarlo en un local propio  para brindar la oportunidad de empleo a otras personas y mejorar sus ingresos logrando una estabilidad económica que le permita mejorar la calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Marelby, 29, is single and has no children.  She lives with two grandparents and a younger brother.  Currently she works as a nurse's assistant.  It's a very unstable job, though, because she works on contract or by the hour, which creates financial problems in her household.

With her enterprising, energetic, and positive attitude, she wants to start her own business, a fast-food stall where she'll work on the weekend from 5 p.m. until midnight.  She hopes to earn a better income to support her family.

So her business idea will work, she's requesting a loan for help in buying fixed assests (a griddle, a cart, a canopy, kitchen utensils, and a refrigerator) for 1,000,000 pesos [COP] and supplies (cold cuts, bread, sauces, soda) for 500,000 pesos.  This way she'll be able to offer her customers a variety of products to satisfy their tastes.  She hopes to make progress and get her family ahead.

Marelby dreams of making her business grow, setting it up in her own space to give work to other people.  She also dreams of improving her income and achieving economic stability so she can improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fixed assets and supplies

loans.name: Tina

texts.en:
Tina is a 43-year-old divorced woman living with her child in the suburb of the capital city. Tina has recently returned from Turkey where she worked for 8 months to cover the costs of her child’s medical treatment. Before that occasion, Tina used to import secondhand furniture from Turkey and sold them in Georgia. She wants to restart up the trading business but found she didn’t have enough money to do so.

Tina couldn’t receive a loan from the local financial institutions, because of their requirements to have business experience or stable revenue, until the Start Up program began which is a joint product of Kiva and Credo. The program allows vulnerable poor like Tina to get a chance for starting or re-starting businesses. She requested a loan of 1200 USD to restart trading furniture. Tina will go to Turkey and purchase the products at wholesale prices and then resell among her old customers who already expressed an interest in buying the furniture. Part of the loan will be used for partitioning her house. Tina will rent out half of it to get a monthly income.

Because of the Start Up program, Tina will be able to make savings and provide a better future for her child.

loans.use: to import secondhand furniture from Turkey and to partition her house for renting out.

loans.name: Samer

texts.en:
Samer is a 32-year-old single man from Bethlehem. He lives in a simple house with his parents. Samer works as an employee and gets a low income. Samer started preparing his own home, which he will live in when he gets married and is independent.

Samer requested a loan of 2,000 USD from FATEN. This loan will help him to complete his new home, especially the paint, so that it will be ready as soon as possible, so that he and his future wife can live in it.

In the photo, Samer is painting in his home.

loans.use: to complete his new home, especially the paint.

loans.name: Kuña Pora Group

texts.es:
El grupo Kuña Pora está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de  Concepción, la cual es una zona un poco alejada de la zona céntrica y aun se encuentra en crecimiento. Es una zona de difícil acceso, por lo que las integrantes de este grupo quieren luchar por ir creciendo y dar a la zona donde viven un mejor ambiente y que vayan creciendo lentamente.
La Sra. Maria es una de las integrantes, ella es de una colonia pequeña en distrito de la ciudad BELÉN donde tiene su pequeño negocio de Venta de frutas y verdura mercería, producto de limpieza y carnicería. Como se puede ver ella es muy trabajadora y quiere conforme vaya pasando los ciclos ir mejorando y asa salir adelante.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de insumos, como ser frutas y verduras para la venta, y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo con su negocio y dar así a su familia lo que necesitan para tener una vida sin privaciones.
texts.en:
The Kuña Pora group is in the second cycle of their program with the women's communal bank. They are from the city of Concepción in an area somewhat removed from the main city and still in development. this area is difficult to access, for this reason the members of this group are fighting to grow and provide the area where they live a better environment and to encourage it to slowly grow.

María is one of the members and she originates from a small administrative division within a municipality of the city of Belén. There she keeps her small business selling fruits, vegetables, novelties, cleaning supplies and meats. She is a very hard worker and wants to improve as the cycles pass and in this way get ahead. She requests this loan for the purchase of consumable goods such as fruits and vegetables to be sold so that she may continue growing with her business. She wishes to provide her family with what they need so that they may have a life without want.

loans.use: to purchase consumable goods such as fruits and vegetables to be sold

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina is a 23-year-old married woman with two children living in Masindi, Uganda. She has been selling food in the market since 2007. With the proceeds she has been able to look after her children because the sole responsibility rests on her since her husband has no employment. 

She has hopes of having a good house in the future and setting up a restaurant. However, high competition and limited capital is a setback. Madina intends to use the loan to buy food like Irish potatoes and bananas to sell.

loans.use: to buy food like Irish potatoes and bananas to sell.

loans.name: Sa'dyiah

texts.en:
Sa'dyiah is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in the photo in front of their home. 

Sa'diyah is a 33-year-old married woman. She is a mother of one young daughter. Sa'diyah's husband is a worker with a very low wage. It is not enough to cover all the family's needs. Sa'diyah and her husband would like to complete the family's new home so they can live in better conditions.

Sa'diyah took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the costs of completing the family home, especially installing windows and doors.

loans.use: to pay the costs of completing the family home, especially installing windows and doors.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
El Sr. Antonio es casado tiene un hijo, se dedica a la venta independiente hace mas de 2 años,  por lo general sus productos son toallas, ollas, sabanas, electrodomésticos, etc. Los mismos los vende por el gran Asunción y por el interior en su moto carga. Es una persona muy sacrificada, que por medio de su esfuerzo quiere dar a su familia lo que necesitan y que no tengan que pasar por necesidades.
Dicho préstamo pide para la compra de más productos para la temporada de invierno, como camperas, frazadas y edredones. Todo esto le dará un mejor margen de ganancia a su actividad, lo que le ayudara a mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Antonio is married and has a son. He has worked as an independent salesman for more than 2 years. 

In general his products are towels, saucepans, sheets, electrical appliances e.t.c. He sells these things in Greater Asunción and from the inside of his motorcycle trailer. 

He is a very sacrificial person, who through his efforts wants to give his family what they need so they don't want for anything. 

He is asking for this loan to buy more products for the winter season, such as jackets, blankets and quilts. All this will give him a better profit margin in his business, which will help him to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy jackets, blankets and quilts.

loans.name: Kankoe

texts.fr: Mr Kankoe vit avec sa famille(femme et 02 enfants de 05 et 03ans à Lomé). Il est agent de sécurité dans une société et en même temps loue les chaises aux personnes pour les manifestations. Sa clientèle s'élargit de jour en jour et n'arrivant plus à répondre aux besoins des clients, mr Kankoe demande un premier crédit à WAGES pour acheter des chaises en vue de louer et de revendre à ses derniers. Il espère à l'avenir, ouvrir un magasin et bien nourrir la famille.
texts.en: Mr. Kankoe lives with his family (wife and two children, who are 5 and 3 years old, in Lomé). He is a security guard at a private company, and at the same time he rents out chairs to people for gatherings. His customer base is growing day to day, and he no longer can respond to the need. Mr. Kankoe is asking for an initial loan from WAGES to purchase some chairs with the aim of renting and selling them. For the future, he hopes to open a store and have a well-fed family.

loans.use: to rent chairs

loans.name: Reinerio

texts.es:
El Sr. Reinero es una persona muy trabajadora, que por medio de su taxi se gana la vida honradamente, es muy sacrificado y luchador, su anterior crédito en Kiva lo uso para implementar un nuevo taxi, por lo que esta muy agradecido. El hoy pide de nuevo otro crédito para poder invertirlo en en el mantenimiento de su vehículo y en pintura para el mismo, ya que este es su medio de subsistir y ayudar a sus seres queridos.
Agradece por esta nueva oportunidad que recibe que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Reinero is a very hardworking person who earns an honest living with his taxi. He is very self-sacrificing and is a fighter. 

He used his previous Kiva loan to put a new taxi into service, for which he is very grateful. Now, he is asking for another loan in order to invest in the maintenance and painting of his vehicle, as this is his means of subsistence and his way of helping out his loved ones. 

He is grateful for this new opportunity that he is receiving; it will be of great help to him.

loans.use: to perform maintenance and paint his vehicle.

loans.name: Sokea's Group

texts.en:
Sokea is 32 years old and married. She lives with her family in a rural area located in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She has two dependent children, one of whom is still in school. Rice farming and sesame growing are the primary sources of her family’s income and she has been in this business for ten years. With the current business, she can earn approximately 28,000KHR per day and save about 10,000KHR each day for the future needs. 
Sokea has been with VisionFund for three cycles and completely paid back her past loans, which she used to improve her standard of living. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income and make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Ibtesam

texts.en:
Ibtesam is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in the photo. 

Ibtesam is a 46-year-old married woman from Qalqilia. She lives with her husband and four daughters in a simple old house. Ibtesam's husband works as a construction worker and gets a low income and barely covers the family needs. This job is seasonal so his income is not stable. 

Ibtesam took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to repair the family house, especially the paint. Taking this loan will help the family with part of their urgent expenses. This will provide them with better living conditions.

loans.use: to repair the family house, especially the paint

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is a 27-year-old married woman with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in a retail business for two years and works six hours a day. Her retail business is located on a highway; she also has an agriculture business as additional income. Juliet started this business to cater to her family needs, and has so far reaped tangible benefits. She hopes to expand the business and build another house; however, debtors and inadequate capital are her major challenges. Juliet is requesting a loan to buy sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar to sell in her retail business.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is 26 years old. She lives in Masindi, Uganda. She is a married woman charged with the responsibility of taking care of three children. She has a beauty salon which she started in 2010. However she is challenged with stiff competition while her dream is to modernize her salon to a beauty parlor. Christine intends to use the loan to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics.

loans.name: Pet's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager from Battambang province’s Moung Russey District, Pet lives with his wife and seven children; one of whom is dependent. He is 54 years old and he plants rice on three hectares of farmland in the rainy season. It is his main source of income. He has been involved with this business for 35 years. 

Pet is a seventh-cycle client with VisionFund and has successfully repaid previous loans. The past loans have helped him to manage his business better than before. Now he leads a group of two members to request a new loan. He is seeking a loan amount of 500,000 KHR while another one is applying for 1,000,000 KHR. As the group leader, he will spend his loan portion to buy fertilizer for his farmland. He hopes to make a good income to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his farmland.

loans.name: Milly

texts.en:
Milly is 33 years old and a resident of Ndikutamadda LC1 zone in a rural area. She has three children and also two dependents. Milly has an obligation to take care of her sister’s children (her sister passed away three years ago)-that is paying their tuition from the little income she earns from her business.

Milly started this business three years ago as source of income after she had graduated from university. She started this business as a way of supporting herself and her family since she is the sole  bread-winner of the entire family, due to the fact that her husband is jobless.

Milly’s business is strategically located, but her major challenge is inadequate capital which doesn’t enable her to buy enough stock for her business which also hinders its growth and expansion, hence she is requesting to be funded. She acquired a loan of UGX 2,000,000= to help her increase her stock by buying daily house hold use items for sell to be able to increase her income.

Her neighbors commended her for being hard-working, determined, and supportive in society matters.

loans.use: To buy daily household use items for sale.

loans.name: Khawla

texts.en: Khawla is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her father appears in the photo. Khawla is a 30-year-old married woman from a small village near Ramallah. She lives in a humble house with her husband. Khawla's father sells fruits and vegetables in the village. He buys seasonal crops from local farmers and resells them. It is a profitable job, but needs more money to improve it. Khawla took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her father to buy more fruits and vegetables to resell in the local market. This will improve the family's income. Khawla's father would like to take a bigger loan in the future and expand his business.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to resell in the local market.

loans.name: Yom's Group

texts.en:
Yom, a citizen from the Ponhea Krek district, is a 41-year-old married mother of seven children. Some of her children are in school. She and her husband have been growing cassava and rubber trees for 22 years. The current business has returned about 30,000 KHR per day in order to support the rest of her family. 

This is Yom’s first loan with Kiva's partner VisionFund. Now, Yom and a group member are seeking a loan of 500,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her cassava and rubber tree farming. She expects to double her crop yield to sell at a good price and extend her farmland to maintain her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her cassava and rubber tree farming business.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Despiner

texts.en:
Despiner lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children and two children go to school. She has two additional family members. She sells used clothes at the market on a retail basis. She has been in business for the last four years. She works six days a week.  

Despiner has requested a loan of Uganda shillings 1,000,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy a bale of used clothes. Her major business challenge is transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a plot of land. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy a bale of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Robina

texts.en: Robinah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has four children, one of whom goes to school. She has no additional family members. She operates a retail shop at the market. She receives additional income from farming. She has been in business for the last two years. She works seven days a week. She has applied for a loan of 200,000 UGX (Ugandan shillings) from MCDT – SACCO to buy cooking oil, sugar, rice, flour and soap. Her major business challenges are transportation, price changes and defaulters. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a fridge, in order to start selling cold drinks. She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, a bag of flour, rice and flour for her shop.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has three children, and two of her children go to school. She has no additional family members. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees. 

She operates a retail shop at the market. She gets additional income from making liquid soap and farming. She has been in business for the last 10 years. She works seven days a week. 

She has requested a loan of Uganda shillings 2,000,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy cooking oil, sugar, rice, flour, soap and crates of soda. Her major business challenge is transportation and electricity. Her aspiration is to buy an improved machine for making liquid soap.

loans.use: To buy bags of beans, sugar and rice, boxes of soap and crates of soda.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, and all her children go to school. She has one additional family member. She operates a restaurant at the market on a retail basis. She has been in business for the last 20 years. She works six days a week.  

She has requested a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas, rice, cooking oil and a bag of charcoal. Her major business challenges are transportation and fluctuating food prices. Her goal and aspiration is to educate her children to the university level. She lives in her own house, and the family has access to electricity, but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: to buy bunches of green bananas and cooking oil.

loans.name: Cotilda

texts.en:
Cotilda lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed with four children and two of them go to school. She takes care of additional family members. She sells charcoal from home on a retail basis. She has been in business for the last 4 years. She works seven days a week.  

She has requested a loan of Uganda shillings 500,000 from MCDT–SACCO to buy bags of charcoal to resell. Her major business challenge is transportation and seasonality. Her goal and aspiration is to build rental houses, and also to buy a van for transporting charcoal from the village. She lives in her own house where the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and power charges.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a businessman, married with two children. He concentrates on rentals to earn income to meet the needs of his household. He lets out the rooms to people at a monthly fee. He contracts houses for low income earners and he has over 10 rooms at the moment. 
Peter has applied of UGX 3,000,000 to roof the new rooms under construction in the city outskirts. He hopes when the rooms are complete he will be able to earn income to meet his family needs adequately since he takes care of several dependants. The loan will increase his monthly collections that will be used in paying back the loan installments and expanding the rooms.
In set is Peter(left) with the Ugafode staff and the houses he intends to roof.

loans.use: To buy roofing materials

loans.name: Ahammadah

texts.en:
Ahammadah is 30 years old and married with 4 children. He is an agriculturalist who primarily grows coffee and bananas for his livelihood. Ahammadah boasts of paying tuition for his children, providing food, and also constructing a permanent house for his family.

He is applying for a loan of 1,800,000 UGX to buy fertilizers for his coffee and banana plantation. Ahammdah’s major challenges are soil infertility, pests, and diseases, which attack his plantation. With 1,800,000 UGX he will be able to buy organic fertilizers and also buy pesticides for his banana and coffee plantations. His dream is to be the leading coffee producer in his region. Ahammadah is honest and hard working.

loans.use: To buy organic manure

loans.name: Haluwah

texts.en:
Haluwah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children and three are in school. She has no additional family members. She sells fruits and vegetables at the market on retail basis. She gets additional income from selling piped water. She has been in business for the last three years. She works seven days a week. 

She has requested a loan of Uganda shillings 200,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy bunches of sweet banana, pineapple, water melon, greens, and Irish potatoes. Her major business challenge is the ever increasing prices of fruits and vegetables and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to become a wholeseller and also to buy a plot of land. She lives in rented house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include medication and food.

loans.use: To buy a bag of sweet potatoes, pineapples, water melon and Irish potatoes.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 33-year-old Mamie from Torkpoi town Bo. She is married with two children between the ages of five and 10 years. Her children are currently attending school. 

Mamie runs a general stock business; she sells soft drinks, mayonnaise, biscuits and sweets. She has been running this business for 15 years. She works at the business throughout the week and 10 hours per day. Mamie says that sometimes sales are very difficult.

Mamie has requested a loan in order to purchase soft drinks, mayonnaise, biscuits and sweets for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to pay her children's school fees and increase her business. In the future, she plans to expand her enterprise more than ever. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, mayonnaise, biscuits and sweets for resale.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a married man aged twenty-eight, with two children all going to school.

He is a businessman who deals in produce trade and has a retail shop. He also supplements his income with agriculture, specifically in banana and coffee growing. He will use the loan to buy coffee to sell.
