He runs three stores at his home, plus retail shop that is managed by his wife. He also has a banana plantation and other gardens that can fetch him a good income at the end of a month. He says he works seven days in a week, though he has labourers who help him on Sundays under his supervision.

He started this business of agricultural produce in 2008 and he says he has been able to meet his daily demands through the business. He says the need to take care of his family instigated him to start this business and has reaped big rewards from it. He says that his main clients are fellow coffee traders and small scale companies involved in coffee transportation, as well as schools around him who buy maize and beans. 

He describes himself as a hardworking man and appreciates the work of Ugafode of providing affordable financial services to the active poor. He grows coffee and also trades in it, by buying from other farmers.

loans.use: To buy coffee to sell

loans.name: Christian

texts.en:
Meet 35-year-old Christian from Torkpoi town Bo in Sierra Leone. She is married with two children. Her children are going to school. In 2005, Christian established her palm oil business. She began her business because she needs to generate income to take care of herself and her family. She works at the business every day from morning to night. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and transportation.

Christian requires a loan in order to purchase palm oil, garri, and general stock. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and repay her loan. In the future, Christian plans to see her business through to a higher level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil, garri, and general stock for her food market business.

loans.name: Fahda

texts.en:
Fahda is a 44-year-old divorced mother of two children. She is working hard to develop her business to provide them with the best living conditions and education. She has been working for four years in preparing and selling special creamy minced garlic. It is specialized for restaurants where it is served with all kinds of chicken and in most sandwiches to add a delicious juicy taste. Fahda's business is going on just fine, but needs development to increase her family's income and meet her children's needs. She is applying for a loan from Kiva Partner Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise to expand her business. 

Through the loan, Fahda will buy more garlic and special containers so she can pack her production and distribute it among customers. This increase in production will reflect positively on her family's socioeconomic situation. Fahda will work hard to develop and expand her business; she will also work on diversifying her production, but in the meantime she has no idea about the new item she's going to start with.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise to expand her food production business.

loans.name: Azizi Group

texts.en: Rehema, who is a member of Azizi Group, is married and lives with her husband. Together, they are blessed with four children: three sons and a daughter. Her three children are enrolled in school while one is still a baby. Rehema, who is in her late 30's, is running a Mama Lishe business offering food services like breakfast and lunch. She starts working from 6am to 2pm daily and is able to earn a good profit per month. This will be her ninth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy more cooking items and replaced the old business equipments with new one like chairs, cooking pans and plates. She has repaid all her previous loans successfully. With the profit received she covered home expenses and school fees. She will use this loan to buy soft drinks to resell. She dreams that one day will be able to build a nice house and provide a better education to her children. She will share this loan with her loan group "Azizi," which totals 10 members, who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks to resell for her food production and sales business.

loans.name: Numon

texts.ru:
Нумон житель города Истаравшан Согдийской области, расположенный в северной части Таджикистана. Он является скотоводом и земледельцем. Ему 56 лет. У него есть жена, сын, невестка и двое внуков. Нумон с 2005 года занимается купле-продажей овец. Овцеводческий бизнес является их семейным бизнесом. Ему помогает жена и сын.        Одновременно он занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственной культуры на 0,6 га участке земли. 
Сейчас в хозяйстве Нумона осталось только два овца. Чтобы продолжить животноводческий бизнес, ему необходимо увеличить поголовье овец. С такой целью он запрашивает кредит для закупа 20-голов овец и корма. Нумон обычно спустя двух месяца откармливания овец, продает их на скотном рынке города и получает хорошую прибыль.
texts.en:
Numon is a resident of the town of Istaravshan in the Sogdiyskiy region which is located in the northern part of Tajikistan. He is a rancher and farmer. He is 56 years old and has a wife, son, daughter-in-law and two grandchildren. Nomon has been buying and reselling sheep since 2005. Livestock sheep business is their family business. His wife and son are helping him. At the same time he also cultivates crops on a 0.6 hectares of land.

Right now Numon only has two sheep in his business. To continue his ranching business he needs to increase the headcount of sheep. He is asking for a loan with this purpose to buy 20 heads of sheep and fodder. Numon usually feeds the sheep for two months and then sells them on the cattle market of the town and gets a good profit.

loans.use: to buy twenty heads of sheep and fodder to expand the business.

loans.name: Bairon Angel

texts.es: Don Bairon, es padre de tres hijos los cuales son estudiantes de secundaria, su esposa es ama de casa, por lo que todos dependen de don Bairon, el continua su labor como guarda de seguridad. Solicita el crédito para continuar haciendo el porche de su casa el cual no ha podido terminar ya que va poco a poco porque sus ingresos son muy bajos, con el préstamo desea comprar más materiales para poder terminar esta construcción, de esa manera tener más espacio y seguridad para la familia dentro de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Don Bairon is the father of three children who are students in secondary school.  Since his wife is a housewife, everyone depends on Bairon, who continues his work as a security guard.  

He seeks this loan to continue building the porch of his house which he has not yet been able to complete as he works at it a little at a time because his income is very small.  With the loan he wants to purchase materials that will allow him to complete this construction, which will provide more space and security for the family within the house.

loans.use: to purchase cement, cinder blocks, sand, purlins, and zinc.

loans.name: Keila Rebeca

texts.es: Joven de 28 años de edad es Keila, habitante del barrio Carlos Núñez, una zona marginal de Managua, el esposo trabaja como guarda de seguridad, su pequeño hijo tiene la edad de 8 años quien va a una escuela pública del barrio. Keila se dedica al negocio de pulpería, medio de ayuda para la alimentación de la familia, ella tiene muchos deseos de crecer y tener mejor calidad de vida, por lo que solicita el crédito para invertirle con más productos de mayor demanda por sus clientes, para continuar las ventas diaria.
texts.en:
Keila is a 28-year-old young woman, an inhabitant of barrio Carlos Núñez, a marginalized neighborhood in Managua. Her husband works as a security guard and her 8-year-old son studies at a public school in her neighborhood. 

Keila makes a living from her general store, whose her earnings help feed her family. She wishes to grow and to have a better quality of life, and thus requests the loan to buy more high-demand products for her customers, which she can continue to sell.

loans.use: to buy cereals, basic grains, meat, eggs and other products.

loans.name: Diego De Jesús

texts.es: Diego, con 46 años de edad es padre de 2 hijos y vive en unión libre con su pareja. Toda su vida la ha pasado en el campo, donde aprendió las labores agrícolas, especialmente con cultivos de caña de azúcar, debido a que la región donde reside se dedica básicamente a esa labor, además su familia también es de cañicultores. Actualmente, Diego labora en un trapiche panelero, actividad que alterna con el cuidado de los cultivos de caña de su propiedad, en los cuales trabaja los fines de semana, pues debe cumplir con el horario d trabajo en el trapiche, por esa razón debe contratar jornaleros para que lo apoyen con el cuidado de los cultivos. Los ingresos que obtiene son el resultado del salario del trapiche y de la venta de la cosecha de caña, la cual vende en el mismo trapiche donde trabaja, esto le permite tener los recursos para llevar el sustento diario a su hogar. El crédito que solicita, desea invertirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas (abonos, fertilizantes y pesticidas) para continuar con el cuidado de su cultivo y pagar la nómina de los jornaleros que contrata. Diego sueña con ampliar sus cultivos, que sean óptimos y que le permitan brindarle una estabilidad económica a su familia, mejor educación a sus hijos y mejorar la calidad de vida de todos.
texts.en:
Diego, 46, has two children and lives in a common-law marriage. He has lived all his life in the countryside, where he learned to work in agriculture, especially with sugar cane. This is because it is the main economic activity of this region and because it is his family’s business.

Diego is currently working for a panela mill [unrefined whole cane sugar] . He also takes care of his own plantation where he works during the weekends, since he has to follow the mill’s timetable. This is why he has to hire day laborers that help him with the maintenance activities. His income comes from his work at the mill and from growing and selling the cane (to the same mill where he works). This way, he can make enough to maintain his family. 

Diego is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies (compost, fertilizers and pesticides) in order to continue taking care of his plantation and to pay for the labor. His dream is to expand his plantations and make them more productive, so that he can give his family more financial stability, give his children a better education and improve the whole family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies (compost, fertilizers and pesticides).

loans.name: Shavkidin

texts.ru: Шавкидину 40 лет. Он живет вместе со своей семьей на южной части Таджикистана. Шавкидин всегда заботится о своей семье. Он старается, чтобы его жена и дети жили в достатке и в красивом и удобном доме. Жена Шавкидина домохозяйка и поэтому он является единственным кормильцем семьи. Он более 18 лет работает в компании по разработки алюминий. Он очень трудолюбивый и честный человек и поэтому выполняет свою функцию отлично. Шавкидин более 2 лет является клиентом ИМОН. Он своевременно делает погашения. Шавкидин несколько лет назад начал стройку дома, но все еще не достроил этот дом. Шавкидин планирует построить баню, кухню и отремонтировать фасадную часть дома. Он не имеет сбережения для того, чтобы купить строительные материалы и осуществить свой план. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 9000 сомони для покупки цемента, древесины, песок, краски и т.п. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Shavkidin is 40 years old. He lives together with his family in the southern part of Tajikistan. Shavkidin always takes care of his family. He tries hard so his wife and children live in prosperity and in a beautiful and comfortable house. Shavkidin's wife is a homemaker and that's why he is the only provider for the family. He has been working in a company which makes aluminum for over eighteen years. He is a very hardworking and honest man and that's why he does his job excellently. Shavkidin has been a customer of IMON for over two years. He pays off the loans on time. Shavkidin has started building a house several years ago, but has still not finished building it. Shavkidin plans to build a sauna and kitchen and repair the front of the house. He does not have savings to buy building materials and complete his plan. He is asking for a loan in the amount of 9,000 somoni to buy cement, wood, sand and paint. He is waiting for your kindness and hopes for your generosity.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as cement, wood, sand and paint to build a sauna and kitchen.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr:
Akossiwa est une femme accueillante, mariée et âgée de 29 ans. Elle a un enfant et habite le quartier Adinomoto à Lomé. Depuis 2011, elle s’est lancée dans la restauration de fufu, repas fait à base d’ignames, de boules pâte de maïs et autres mets. 

Elle achète ses condiments au marché d’Hanoukopé et s’approvisionne deux fois par semaine. Vu l’affluence des clients, elle sollicite un prêt pour acheter un demi sac de maïs, de l’igname et des condiments afin d’augmenter ses bénéfices.
texts.en:
Akossiwa is a friendly, 29-year-old married woman.. She has one child and lives in the Adinomoto neighborhood of Lome. Since 2011, she embarked on the preparation of fufu, a meal based on yams, corn-dough balls and other items.

She buys her condiments at the Hanoukopé market and resupplies twice a week. Given the influx of clients, she is requesting a loan to buy half a bag of corn, yams and condiments, to increase her profits.

loans.use: buy one bag of corn

loans.name: Madjodé

texts.fr:
Mariée et mère de trois enfants, Madjodé habite le quartier Avénou et a 49 ans.
Avant de débuter le commerce de produits alimentaires,  elle avait une boutique de commerce général. Mais Madjodé a perdu une partie de son stock suite à la saisie de ses produits par les autorités de contrôle des produits pharmaceutiques. Le reste de son stock aussi a disparu lors de l’incendie de leur maison survenu en 2005.

Soucieuse de l’avenir de ses enfants, elle a changé d’activité et s’est engagée dans le commerce des biscuits et des savons de toilette. Elle s’approvisionne au Grand Marché de Lomé et expose ses marchandises dans la petite boutique rénovée.

Pour agrandir son commerce et augmenter son chiffre d’affaires, elle sollicite ce crédit pour acheter des cartons de biscuits et des savons.
texts.en:
Married with three children, Madjodé lives in the Avénou neighborhood and is 49 years old.

Before starting the food trade business, she operated a general store. But Madjodé lost some of her stock following the seizure of her products by the supervisory authorities of pharmaceutical products. The rest of her stock also disappeared in the fire of their home in 2005.

Concerned about the future of her children, she has changed jobs and is active in the retail sales of cookies and soap. She resupplies at the Main Market of Lomé and exposes her goods in a small renovated shop.

To expand her business and increase its turnover, she is requesting this loan to buy cartons of cookies and soap.

loans.use: Buy 5 boxes of cookies and 3 boxes of soap

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a widowed woman with three children. She describes herself as honest. Rose runs a clothes store, where she sells clothes and bedding. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in an area that is accessible, and her primary customers are local residents. 

Rose describes her biggest business challenge as changes in market prices. She will use the 20,000 Kenyan Shilling loan to buy more clothes for resale. Her business goal is to open a boutique within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will become a successful business lady. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Izodufasha Group

texts.fr:
Guillaume fait partie du groupe  Izodufasha et habite à Bujumbura. Il a 38 ans et est marié à  Soleil, une couturière.

Il fait le commerce  de viande depuis 25 ans.

Il est à son deuxième  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une vache à abattre afin de vendre  une grande quantité de viande,  pour gagner plus.

Dans les années à venir, il  voudrait acheter une parcelle et voir ses enfants continuer leurs études jusqu'à l’université.
texts.en:
Guillaume is part of the Izodufasha group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 38 years old and is married to Soleil, a seamstress.

He has been in the meat business for 25 years.

This is his second credit loan with Turame. With the KIVA loan he obtains, he will increase his capital and buy a cow to be slaughtered in order to sell a large quantity of meat, and earn more.

In years to come, he would like to buy a plot of land and see his children pursue their education up to university level.

loans.use: increase his capital and buy a cow for slaughter,  to sell a large quantity of meat, and earn more.

loans.name: Elkin Darío

texts.es: Elkin, con 39 años de edad, es padre de 3 hijos y vive en unión libre con su pareja. Nació y se crió en el campo, donde aprendió las labores agrícolas al lado de su padre; gracias a ello, hoy en día tiene cultivos de caña de azúcar, cuya cosecha es vendida y de esta manera obtiene los recursos para llevar el alimento a su hogar. El prestatario es un hombre pujante, luchador, dedicado a su familia y a su trabajo, eso lo motiva para trabajar largas jornadas y tratar de salir adelante; día a día lucha para sobrepasar los obstáculos que se le presentan, ha pasado por situaciones económicas difíciles debido al bajo precio de la panela en el mercado, lo que afecta el precio de la caña. Elkin solicita su primer ciclo de crédito para invertirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas (abono, fertilizantes, pesticidas) y para pagar la nómina de los jornaleros que lo apoyan en la realización de esta actividad, con el fin de darle continuidad a su negocio y preparar sus cultivos para cosechar un producto de muy buena calidad, que le permita venderlo a un mejor precio para obtener mejores utilidades. Elkin sueña con mejorar sus cultivos, ampliarlos para obtener de estos una buena renta mensual, que le permita brindarle mejores condiciones de vida a su familia y una mejor educación a sus hijos, para que su futuro sea exitoso.
texts.en:
Elkin, 39, has three children and lives in a common-law marriage. He was born and raised in the countryside, where he learned to work in agriculture from his father. Today, and thanks to this, he owns sugar cane plantations and sells the harvest. This way he makes enough to bring food to his family’s table.

Elkin is a persistent and hardworking man who is devoted to his family and his job. This motivates him to work long shifts and to struggle to get ahead. He fights every day to overcome the obstacles. He has gone through difficult times due to the low prices of the panela [unrefined whole cane sugar] in the market, which in turn affects the price of the sugar cane.

This is Elkin’s first cycle. He is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies (compost, fertilizers and pesticides) and to pay for day laborers that help him with the maintenance activities. This will help him to continue with his business and to prepare the land in order to have a good-quality product that can be sold at good prices, and make good profits.

Elkin dreams of improving and expanding his plantations in order to receive a good monthly income. This would allow him to give his family a better quality of life and offer his children a better education, so that they can be successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies (compost, fertilizers, pesticides).

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 27-year-old married woman with two children. She describes herself as determined. Esther runs a boutique where she sells clothes, and she has been involved in this business for three years. It is located in a competitive place. She describes her biggest business challenge as lack of capital. 

Esther will use the 20,000 Kenyan Shilling loan to buy more clothes for resale. Her business goal is to own a big clothes store within five years.

loans.use: buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Olfat

texts.en:
Olfat is a 24-year-old single woman from Ramallah city. She lives with her family in a small house. Her father works as an employee with a low wage, which barely covers all the family needs. 

Olfat has been working in a sewing workshop for more than five years. She loves her job and she has good sewing experience, but she wants to be independent. She took a US dollar loan from FATEN, which will help her to buy a modern sewing machine so she can start her independent business. This will help to make her dream come true.

loans.use: to buy a modern sewing machine

loans.name: Amélé

texts.fr: Mariée à un  revendeur et maman de 02 enfants de 05 et 02ans. L'ainé seul est scolarisé. Pour contribuer aux besoins de la famille, elle a démarré la vente des boissons alcoolisées depuis 08ans et s'approvisionne généralement chez les grossistes au Grand Marché de Lomé. Sa toute première demande à WAGES lui servira de s'approvisionner en marchandises. Le profit tiré de la vente permettra à madame Amélé d’agrandir son activité et de mieux assurer l'éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Amélé is a retailer and mother to two children of five and two years old respectively. Only the elder of the two children goes to school. In order to contribute to the family's needs, Amémé began selling alcoholic drinks eight years ago and generally gets her supplies from wholesalers in Lomé's Grand Market. Her very first loan from WAGES will be used to get fresh supplies of goods. The profit she makes from her sales will enable her to expand her activity and to be able to provide better for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy drinks.

loans.name: Comlan

texts.fr: Mr Comlan âgé de 39ans a eu la formation de frigoriste. A la fin de son apprentissage, il a ouvert son atelier dans lequel il répare et revend les frigidaires et les climatiseurs. Il s'est fixé des objectifs: ouvrir d'autres points de vente et fonder une famille financièrement stable c'est pour cela, mr Comlan sollicite un premier crédit pour acheter des marchandises et le profit tiré l'aidera à atteindre ses objectifs. Notons qu'il est père de 04 enfants dont 02 scolarisés et a pour femme une revendeuse.
texts.en: Comlan is 39 years old and has been trained as a refrigeration and air-conditioning technician. After his apprenticeship he opened a workshop in which he repairs and resells refrigerators and air-conditioning units. He has set himself objectives to open other sales points and in order to do that create a financially stable family. Comlan is requesting his first loan to buy goods and the profit he generates will help him to achieve his objectives. It should be noted that he is father to four children, two of whom go to school; his wife is a retailer.

loans.use: to buy fridges and an air-conditioning unit.

loans.name: Elba Felicita

texts.es: Elba es una microempresaria de éxito, es casada, tiene 47 años de edad, con dos hijos uno  a su cargo que tiene 19 años de edad, su negocio es la de un taller de carpintería en su domicilio desde hace cinco años, su esposo le ayuda en el negocio y tiene dos trabajadores asalariados, tiene de ser cliente de la institución 10 años consecutivos donde inicio con montos pequeños  y en grupos solidarios que fue promovida a crédito individual. Este crédito lo invertirá en la compra de madera, pinturas, cener, lijas, etc.
texts.en:
Elba, 47, is a successful entrepreneur. She is married and has two children; one of them is 19 and under her care. Elba has had a carpenter’s workshop at home for five years, helped by her husband and two employees.

Elba has been a client of the institution for ten years. She started with small loans as part of a group and moved into individual loans. With this loan, she will buy wood, paints, thinner, sandpaper, etc.

loans.use: to buy wood, paints, thinner, sandpaper, etc.

loans.name: Dieu Beni Group

texts.fr: Monsieur Lemou - Honoré est âgé de 27ans. Elle est mariée à une ménagère. Il est agriculteur de profession et cultive du maïs. Il a commencé en 1998 et exerce l’activité à SOKODE lieu ou il s’approvisionne également en matières premières. Il sollicite son premier  crédit de WAGES pour acheter des outils de travail. Il veut assurer ses besoins et faire prospérer son activité. Responsable d'un groupement constitué de femmes et d'hommes,ils sont tous dans la culture du mais. Ils veulent voir leur famille s'épanouir et rendre pérenne leurs activités.
texts.en:
Mr. Lemou-Honoré, age 27, is married to a housewife. He's a farmer by trade and grows corn. He started this business in 1998, and runs it in Sokodé, where he also gets his raw materials. 

He's seeking his first loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy work tools. He wants to provide for himself and grow his business.

Mr. Lemou-Honoré is responsible for a group made up of both women and men, who all grow corn. They want to see their families blossom and make their businesses sustainable.

loans.use: to buy work tools

loans.name: José Delio

texts.es: José a sus 68 años de edad es casado y no tiene hijos, toda su vida la ha pasado en el campo, donde aprendió las actividades agropecuarias y gracias a ello, hoy en día tiene cultivos de fríjol, remolacha, repollo y zanahoria. Esta actividad la realiza hace aproximadamente 15 años y vende la cosecha de los productos para obtener de esa manera, los ingresos necesarios para llevar el sustento a su hogar. José es un hombre trabajador,  comprometido y dedicado; ha logrado sobrepasar muchas situaciones difíciles por la inestabilidad económica, debido a que la agricultura es una actividad muy incierta y está expuesto a factores externos que no puede controlar como los cambios climáticos y la inestabilidad en los precios de los insumos, pero esto no lo detiene y siempre va en busca de oportunidades que le permitan seguir adelante, por ello solicita por sexta vez un ciclo de crédito, para invertirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas al por mayor (abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas) para continuar con el cuidado de sus cultivos y sacar una cosecha con óptimas condiciones para su venta, así podrá obtener mayor ganancia por venta y podrá avanzar un poco más para cumplir el objetivo de ampliar sus cultivos y brindar oportunidades de empleo, así mejorará la calidad de vida de su familia teniendo una estabilidad económica favorable.
texts.en:
José, 68, is married and has no children.  He has spent all his living in the country and learning about agriculture, thanks to which he now grows beans, beets, cabbage and carrots.  He has been in this trade for about 15 years and sells his produce to earn enough income to support his household.

José is a hard-working man who is committed and dedicated.  He has been able to overcome many difficult situations due to economic instability; because agriculture is a very uncertain activity and is exposed to external factors one cannot control such as climate change and fluctuating prices of supplies.  But this has not stopped him from looking for opportunities to get ahead.

Therefore, he is requesting his sixth loan to buy wholesale farm supplies (fertilizers and pesticides) to continue caring for his crops and reaping the best harvest he can to put up for sale.  In this way he will be able to earn more from sales and advance a little more toward his goal of expanding his plantation and offering employment opportunities.  This will improve his family's lifestyle by having a more favorable economic stability.

loans.use: To buy wholesale farm supplies (fertilizers and pesticides).

loans.name: Jhon Fernando

texts.es: Fernando, a sus 21 años de edad es soltero y no tiene hijos. Se dedicaba a laborar en una barbería, pero con el ánimo de obtener más ingresos, decidió montar su propio negocio, aprovechando la experiencia que adquirió, abrió su propia barbería, la cual cuenta con 2 puestos de trabajo y, para complementar sus ingresos vende mercancía como tenis y gorras para hombre. Fernando es un hombre juicioso, emprendedor, muy enérgico y activo, por eso está en constante búsqueda de opciones que le permitan avanzar, por esa razón solicita el préstamo, para invertirlo en el montaje de un nuevo puesto de trabajo para lo cual requiere comprar una silla de peluquería, tocador con espejo, utensilios de trabajo (barbera, máquina de motilar) y además comprará una máquina para hacer tatuajes, con esto logrará atender de forma más ágil a sus clientes y ofrecerá un nuevo servicio, con lo que aumentará sus ingresos y podrá avanzar hacia el cumplimiento de su principal objetivo, que es montar otras sucursales de su barbería, ofreciendo más oportunidades de empleo y así podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de otras personas.
texts.en:
Fernando, 21, is single and has no children.  He used to work in a barber shop but, in order to earn more income, decided to set up his own business.  Taking advantage of the experience he had acquired he opened his own barber shop, which has two work stations.  To earn extra income he also sells merchandise such as men's hats and sport shoes.

Fernando is a sensible, very energetic, active entrepreneur who is constantly seeking options to get ahead.  Therefore, he is requesting a loan to invest in a new work station, which requires a barber chair, station and mirror, work tools (hair styling and trimming) and a tattoo machine.  This will allow him to be more flexible with his customers and offer them a new service, which will increase his income.  He will also be able to advance toward his goal of opening other barber shops so he can offer more employment opportunities.  This will improve his and other people's lifestyles.

loans.use: To buy supplies for his shop and a tattoo machine.

loans.name: Basilisa

texts.es:
La Sra. Basilia tiene 56 años de edad, está  casada con el Sr. Angel, ellos tienen 3 hijos mayores, que hoy en día ya la ayudan en lo que pueden.
Ella empezó trabajando en ventas de  ropas por la calle, que daba a  cuotas, luego logro montar una pequeña despensa con mercería en su casa y con el ingreso de su esposo pudieron ir mejorando cada día más, sumado también al esfuerzo que ambos hacen.
Gracias al trabajo que están  realizando pueden mantenerse y ayudar a la educación de sus nietos .Basilia ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable y honesta con sus compromisos. Comenta que  siempre trata de buscar mejores precios para sus compras y de esa forma venderle a sus clientes a más bajo costo.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para su despensa, como ser carne, aceite, arroz, fideo, harina, yerba entre otros insumos para su despensa y seguir dando a sus clientes lo que quieren.
texts.en:
Basilia, 56, is married to Angel and they have three adult children who help out whenever they can.  Basilia started out working as a street vendor selling clothing.  Then she opened a small grocery store at home, and through their combined hard work and income she and her husband were able to improve their situation day by day.

Thanks to their business they are able to support themselve and help educate their grandchildren.  Basilia has proven herself to be a very responsible person and honest in her commitments.  She says she always tries to look for the best prices when making her purchases so she can sell to her customers at the lowest price possible.

She is requesting a loan to buy goods for her store such as meat, oil, rice, noodles, flour, herbs and other items to continue giving her customers what they want.

loans.use: To buy meat, oil, rice, noodles, flour, herbs and other goods.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El Señor Juan esta en pareja hace 7 años, cuenta con su negocio propio en su casa, que es una surtida despensa donde trabaja igualmente con su pareja.
Ellos son una pareja que están luchando por salir adelante e ir creciendo por medio del trabajo digno, quieren que el día de mañana su pequeña despensa sea un gran establecimiento.
Hoy Juan solicita de este crédito para poder comprar productos como balanceados, fardos de fideos, atún, sardina, gaseosas, cervezas, carne y embutidos a fin de surtir mejor su negocio y que de esa forma sus clientes siempre estén conformes. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe, pues le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Juan has been in a relationship for seven years and runs his own store out of his home where both he and his partner work.

They are struggling to get ahead by earning a decent living so that one day their little store will be a large establishment.

Juan is requesting a loan to buy products such as pet food, noodles, tuna, sardines, soda, beer, meat and sausage in order to stock his store.  This will keep his customers happy.  He is grateful for this opportunity which will be very helpful to him.

loans.use: To buy pet food, noodles, tuna, sardines, sodas, beer, meat and sausage.

loans.name: María Graciela

texts.es: Graciela, a sus 51 años de edad es casada y madre de 7 hijos. Toda su vida la ha pasado en el campo, donde aprendió las labores agropecuarias gracias a las enseñanzas de sus padres. Ella es una mujer emprendedora, pujante y dedicada a su familia, que son su principal motivo para seguir luchando día a día. Actualmente solicita crédito para invertirlo en la compra de ganado de levante (crías de terneras) con el fin de aprovechar el espacio que tiene en la finca donde vive con su familia y criarlos allí, para luego venderlos en las ferias, para lo cual cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que ya tiene experiencia en el sector ganadero; con esto Graciela espera recibir ingresos adicionales para apoyar el sostenimiento económico en su hogar, ya que su esposo es quien lleva la carga completa. Además pretende hacer crecer su negocio ganadero, para que sea rentable y perdurable en el tiempo y así mejorar la calidad de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Graciela, 51, is married and has seven children.  She has spent all her life in the country learning livestock farming from her parents.  She is an energetic entrepreneur who is dedicated to her family which is the main reason she struggles day after day.  She is currently requesting a loan to buy calves in order to take advantage of space she has on the family farm where she will raise them to sell at fairs.

Her husband supports her in her work since he has experience in the livestock sector.  Graciela hopes to increase her income to support the household economy since her husband is the one who is in charge of everything now.  She also wants to grow her livestock business to make it profitable and sustainable.  This will improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy calves.

loans.name: Mauricio

texts.es: Mauricio a sus 23 años de edad es soltero y aún no tiene hijos. Desde los 15 años de dedica a laborar como arrendador de caballos, su trabajo consiste en herrarlos y montarlos para luego entregarlos listos a sus dueños para ser montados; esta actividad la alterna con la ganadería y la producción de leche, pues cuenta con algunas cabezas de ganado  y vacas lecheras en un pequeño lote arrendado. Estas actividades las realiza gracias a las enseñanzas de un amigo. Mauricio es un joven dinámico, emprendedor, pujante y con muchas ganas de progresar, por esa razón solicita el crédito, con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de más ganado de levante (4 novillones) y 1 vaca productora de leche, de esta manera podrá incrementar su producción y por ende, sus ingresos para poder contribuir a la economía de su hogar. Con esto, Mauricio desea avanzar un paso más hacia el cumplimiento de su principal sueño, que es tener una parcela propia para tener su ganado y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y brindarle mejor bienestar a su familia.
texts.en:
Mauricio is 23, single and has no children yet. He has been working taming horses since he was fifteen. He shoes them and rides them so that their owners can ride them later. At the same time, he raises meat and milk cattle in a small piece of land he rents. Mauricio learned these activities from a friend.

Mauricio is a dynamic young man. He is enterprising, persistent and has a strong will to get ahead. This is why he is requesting a loan to buy more cattle to fatten (four castrated bulls) and a milk cow. He will increase his milk production and thus his contribution to the family’s economy. This will be one more step toward the fulfillment of his biggest dream, which is to have his own piece of land where he can raise his cattle, improving his quality of life and offering his family a more comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy more cattle to fatten (four castrated bulls) and a milk cow.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 40-year-old Marie from Moriba town Bo. She is married with four children between the ages of 3 years and 15 years. Three of her children are currently attending school. 

Marie runs a food stand; she sells rice, flour, and cooking seasonings. She has been running this business for 20 years. She works at the business throughout the week, 10 hours per day.  Marie says that sometimes business is very difficult.

Marie has requested a loan in order to purchase cooking seasonings, rice and oil for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to pay her children's school fees and increase her business. In the future, she plans to expand her enterprise even more. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase cooking seasonings, rice and oil for resale

loans.name: Makuti A Group

texts.en:
Veronica, who is in her early 40s, is married with five children of whom all are in school (one is in college and the other four are in secondary). For twenty years now, Veronica has been supporting her family in coordination with her husband by running a 'genge' (small shop) selling fruits and vegetables. She works from 7 am to 4 pm daily and is able to make a good profit per month. 

This will be her 17th loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania, She used the previous loans to buy more 'genge' items like tomatoes, sacks of onions, coconuts, and more vegetables with high demand. She bought two fridges to put in her new retail shop she opened. With the profit from the business, Veronica paid school fees for her children and also home expenses. She will use this loan to buy the missing 'genge' items. She dreams that one day she will be able to own a wholesale business.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Makuti A" which totals 11 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy the missing items for her small shop.

loans.name: Agano Group

texts.en:
Delister, who is in her 30s, is married with one daughter who is in school. For five years now, Delister has had a retail shop with different activities: telephone money transfer (M-pesa, Tigo pesa, Airtel Money), selling airtime and selling telephone accessories. She is doing fine with her business.
She works from 6 am to 11:30 pm daily and is able to make a very good profit per month.

This will be her 10th loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. With the previous loans, all of which were repaid successfully, she opened her current M-pesa business, repaired her business premises, bought business equipment like a computer and a cupboard, and put an aluminum door on her business premises. 

With the profit, she bought a plot of land, paid school fees, paid part of home expenses and reinvested back into the business.  She will use this loan to open another telephone money transfer (M-pesa). She dreams of expanding her business a lot. 

She will share this loan with her loan group "AGANO" which totals five members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to open another telephone money transfer service (M-pesa).

loans.name: Gifty's Group

texts.en:
Gifty's group is comprised of eight members who live in the same neighborhood. It is the seventh time that this group is requesting financial support from ID-Ghana in order to raise its level of activity. 

Gifty, the group's representative, is 44 years old and married to a man named Alex with whom she has two children. Both children are in school and are their dependents. Gifty lives with her husband and children and jointly takes care of the various household expenses with her husband.

Gifty did not go to school but received non-formal education called adult education. She can read and write therefore, which gives her the privilege to transact business with her customers. In order to contribute to the household's various expenses, she has been selling cooking utensils, silver products and plastic chairs, from her home, for the past twenty years. These products are procured from the market at wholesale prices.

In order to satisfy the needs of her customers, and to increase her turnover and income, she is requesting this loan from Kiva through ID-Ghana, along with the other members of Gifty's group. Their previous loans were duly repaid without problem. They need a total amount of GHS 6700 to be able to serve their customers better.

loans.use: To buy cooking utensils, silver products and plastic chairs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make some improvements to her establishment, buy materials to enlarge the chicken pen and buy a stainless steel table.

loans.name: Uvumilivu Group

texts.en:
Rebeca, who is in her early 30s, is married with two sons; one of them is in school. The remaining boy is still a baby. Since 2006, Rebeca has been running two businesses named Genge-Duka selling fruits and vegetables, soft drinks, beers, sugar, fabrics, sarongs and a charcoal business. She works from 7 am to 10 pm daily and is able to make a good return per month.

This will be her 10th loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. With the previous loans, all of which were repaid successfully, she opened a fruit and vegetable business and built business premises where she now expects to have electricity connection; previously, she was renting  premises. With the profit received, she covered school fees, household expenses and started building a house.  She will use this loan to buy more sacks of charcoal and pay for electricity connection in her new business premises. She dreams of owning a big business and growing to a position where she can take her own big loan instead of participating in a group loan. 

Rebeca will share this loan with her loan group" Uvumilivu" which consists of eight members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal and pay for electricity connection in her new business premises.

loans.name: Mahawa

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 42-year-old Mahawa from Moriba town Bo. She is married with three children between the ages of 4 and 15. Two of her children are currently attending school. 

Mahawa runs a general stock business; she sells soft drinks, cigarettes, biscuits, and sweets. She has been running this business for ten years. She works at the business throughout the week and 12 hours per day.  Mahawa says that at present her business is doing well.

Mahawa has requested a loan to purchase soft drinks, cigarettes, biscuits, and sweets to sell. The extra income from this loan will allow her to pay her children's school fees and increase her business. 

In the future, she plans to expand her enterprise even more. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, cigarettes, biscuits, and sweets to sell

loans.name: Unity Group

texts.en:
Aneth, who is in her late 30s, is married with three daughters who are in school. For five years now, Aneth has been running a canteen selling different kinds of food: lunch food (rice with beans, meats, ugali), breakfast (tea with bites) and soft drinks. She is doing fine with her business. She works from 6 am to 5 pm daily, and is able to make a good profit in a month. 

This will be her ninth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to restock more food items along with soft drinks, and has paid back all her loans successfully. With the profit received, she covered school fees and reinvested in the business. She will use this loan to buy a refrigerator for her business.  

Aneth dreams that one day,  she will be able to offer more food services to her food enterprise. 

She will share this loan with her loan group," UNITY", which consists of 13 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils and ingredients for her preparations.

loans.name: Saratou

texts.fr: Veuve née en 1971, madame Saratou se bat chaque jour pour assurer un avenir meilleur à ses deux enfants âgés de 13 et 06ans dont elle a en charge. Elle revend des articles divers(serrures, cadenas,torches...) à SOKODE localité située au Nord du TOGO lieu où elle s'approvisionne également. Avec son premier crédit, madame Saratou va s'approvisionner en marchandises pour mieux répondre aux besoins des clients. Elle espère acheter un terrain et assurer la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en: Born in 1971, Mrs Saratou is a widow, and is faced with daily challenges in her objective of ensuring a better future for her two children aged 6 and 13. She sells diverse products (locks, packlocks, flashlights, etc) in Sokode, situated in the northern part of Togo. She also stocks up on merchandise in this region. She is asking for her first loan in order to purchase more merchandise to better respond to her customer's requests. She hopes to purchase land in the future, as well as ensure the education of her children.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to re-sell

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef is a 60-year-old single man. He has been working as a mobile gum, tobacco, and toy seller for 45 years at the same spot he is working now. 

Youssef is handicapped, so this condition has not allowed him to truly advance in his career and life goals, especially since he is responsible for his sisters, too, which is an additional burden he has to take care of. 

Al Majmoua is Youssef's last hope for getting a decent living. In fact, he decided to contact Al Majmoua and acquire a loan to purchase stands and merchandise to increase his business capital and income. 

In the future, Youssef wishes to further expand his business.

loans.use: To increase his merchandise and buy more boxes of tobacco.

loans.name: Bilam Group

texts.fr: Agriculteur de profession, Mr Sakye est né en 1980. Il vit avec sa femme exerçant la même activité que lui et ses 03 enfants en RÉGION CENTRALE. Seul le premier est scolarisé. Vu qu’il a une grande superficie, 07 personnes l’aident dans l’exercice de son activité. Pour la rendre pérenne, il sollicite de WAGES un premier crédit dans notre institution(WAGES) pour acheter des outils de travail. Il voudrait avec le profit supplémentaire agrandir son activité. Comme perspectives d’avenir, il souhaiterait acheter un tracteur et permettre à sa famille de mieux s’épanouir. Notons qu’il est le responsable d’un groupement de femmes et d’hommes tous ayant foi en la terre. Ils cultivent du riz, du mais et espèrent rendre pérenne leur activité.
texts.en: Born in 1980, Mr Sakye works in agriculture. He lives with his wife, who also works in agriculture, and their three children in the Central Region of Togo. Only their eldest child attends school. Given the size of the land, Mr Sakye employs seven people to help him in his business activity. In order to achieve his goal of become financial sustainable, he is asking for his first loan from WAGES in order to purchase farming tools. He will reinvest the profits into the business to ensure its growth. In the future, he hopes to purchase a tractor and enable his family to be happier. He is also the leader of a group of men and women that all strongly believe in agricultural work. They cultivate rice and maize, and hope their activities will be sustainable in the future.

loans.use: purchase farming tools

loans.name: Zebra Group

texts.en:
Fredy, a man who is married with two sons and three daughters, is in his early 50's. One of the children is in school. 

For ten years now, Fredy has been running a business selling fruit and vegetables, commonly known as genge. He is doing great with his activities. He works from 8 am to 9 pm daily, and is able to make a fair return in a month. 

This will be his tenth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. With the previous loans all paid back successfully, he managed to restock more fruit and vegetables. With the genge profit received, he paid school fees, covered home costs, and other basic needs expenses. 

Fredy will use this loan to replenish more genge items - fruit, vegetables, onions, tomatoes, etc. He dreams that one day, he will be able to have a good performing fruit and vegetable business, which will enable him to more easily meet his family's basic needs. 

He will share this loan with his loan group, "Zebra", which totals ten members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to replenish more genge/grocery items -fruit, vegetables, onions, tomatoes, etc.

loans.name: Mwandege Mbagara Group

texts.en:
Fatuma, who is her early 40s, is single with her own five children. Three are in school, while the other two are finished with school and independent. 

For seven years now, Fatuma has been managing her family by running genge (grocery) business selling fruit, vegetables, onions, tomatoes, and other food related items. She works from 7 am to 9 pm daily, and is able to make a fair profit each month. 

This will be her fifth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. With the previous loans, all of which paid back successfully, she bought more genge/grocery items which she sold. Fatuma's business profit was used to cover her children's school expenses and household expenses. 

She will use this loan to open another fruit and vegetable business in a different area. She dreams that one day she will be able to build a house and expand her genge/grocery business. 

She will share this loan with her loan group " MWANDEGE MBAGARA", which totals 10 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to open another fruit and vegetable business in a different area.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria es una mujer de 34 años de edad, está casado y vive junto a sus tres hijos en su casa construida a base de madera. Gloria tiene un negocio en su casa en donde se dedica a la venta de refrescos preparados a base de fruta fresca para realizar está actividad cuenta con refrigeradora en donde se encuentran sus bebidas, estos productos tienen buena aceptación entre sus vecinos y los peatones que circulan por su zona. Lo que mas le agrada es que puede obtener ingresos para solventar los gastos de su familia estando en casa y al pendiente de sus hijos ya que son aún pequeños y trata de apoyarlos siempre en lo que sea necesario.
Uno de sus principales objetivos a largo plazo es edificar su vivienda  con ladrillos y cemento esperando así mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Este es su tercer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
En esta ocasión desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles y comprar frutas al por mayor para la preparación de sus refrescos y helados de hielo.
texts.en:
Gloria is a 34-year-old woman. She is married and lives with her three children in a wooden house. Gloria owns a store where she sells beverages made with fresh fruits. She has a refrigerator, where she stores her products. Neighbors and passersby like her products. What she likes the most is to have an income to cover the home expenses, while staying at home to take care of her children, who are still young. She tries to help them with anything they need.

One of Gloria’s main long-term goals is to rebuild her house using bricks and cement, hoping to improve her family’s quality of life. This is her third loan with Kiva and she feels grateful for the financial support she receives to get ahead. She also promises to pay the installments on time.

This time, she needs 1,000 nuevos soles [PEN] to buy fruits in bulk to prepare beverages and popsicles.

loans.use: to buy fruits in bulk.

loans.name: Machimbo Group

texts.en:
Hawa, who is in her late 30s, is married and has one son and four daughters. The operator of a business selling fruits and vegetables for five years now, she works from 6 a.m. to 9 p.m, daily, and is able to earn a fair return each month.

This will be Hawa's second loan from Tujijenge, Tanzania, her previous loan, since repaid, having been used to restock items such as fruits, tomatoes, onions, and other vegetables, all of which normally sell out quickly. She used her profits to cover school fees. She will use this loan to replenish her fruit and vegetable stock. Hawa dreams of providing a better education to her children.

Hawa will share this loan with her loan group "Machimbo," which consists of nine members. Machimbo group members will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to replenish her  fruit and vegetable stock.

loans.name: Hyqmet

texts.en:
For Hyqmet, this will be his first loan even though he has been running his own livestock business for almost 20 years and also has been working in the construction industry for a very long time. The loan that he is requesting is in an amount of 200,000 Albanian Lek (ALL), and he wants to build a better stable than what you see in the background of the picture.

Hyqmet is 47 years old and has two children, 23 and 16 years old, and both of them are attending school. “I have been able to make a decent income whether through the selling of raw milk to a local dairy farm or through my construction activity up to now. But the more my children grew, the more our family’s expenses increased as well, and this is why I never needed a loan before, but I do now, “ Hyqmet said, smiling.

loans.use: To build a better stable.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
Mamie, 39, operates a cook shop (restaurant) that sells rice and soup in the Paynesville South area of Liberia. It is a suburb of the capital city of Monrovia and one of the most populated areas in Montserrado County. The area boasts one of the best standards of living in the county with affordable rents, good roads, access to water and lots of transportation options. 

Mamie is married and has two children, age 20 and 19, who are living at home with her. They are currently attending some college. 

She was unable to attend school, but she manages her business well. She started this business with money given to her by her husband. She enjoys her business because the business gives her more money. She sells six days a week, from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m., and most of the time she uses a shared taxi to get her goods to her shop. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, fish, pepper, vita, onion, etc., for her business. She plans to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, fish, pepper, vita, onion, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Bairon Osvaldo

texts.es: Bairon  de 43 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos y su esposa, el posee un molino desde hace varios años tiene mucha clientela principalmente las señoras que elaboran tortillas pues ahí llegan a moler el maíz para elaborarlas,  también  todo tipo de alimentos, como frijoles, harinas, salsas, entre otros,  ya que el es una persona muy amable y responsable, Bairon  solicita un crédito para poder comprar cuchillas, discos, limas y todas las herramientas necesarias para tener un buen molino y así seguir con su trabajo para darles el sustento diario a su familia sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Bairon is 43 years old and lives in a house of his own with his two sons and his wife. He has had a grinder for years and has many customers, particularly women who need to grind sweetcorn to make tortillas, as well as people who need his services for other aliments, such as broad beans, flour, and sauce. Bairon is a very nice and responsible person, which is why he has so many customers. He asks for a loan to buy blades, discs, files, and all the tools he needs to keep his grinder in good repair and be able to keep on with his business in order to support his family without fearing the future.

loans.use: to buy blades, discs, files, etc.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: José de 48 años vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus tres hijos en casa propia, él  se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, adicional a eso siembra jícamas cuando es la temporada, tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, sus cosechas las comercia en los alrededores de la comunidad, ya tiene mucha clientela que lo prefiere por la calidad, los buenos precios y sobre todo por el buen servicio; José necesita invertir por eso le solicita un crédito que le permita comprar semillas de maíz, frijol, insecticida, herbicida, fertilizantes, etc. José tiene buenas referencias de pago por parte de sus conocidos, y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda en el periodo establecido y a la vez confía que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en: José is 48 years old. He lives with his life's companion and their three children in their own home. He grows corn and beans as well as jicama when it is in season. He has been working for several years in farming and that has given him a lot of experience that allows him to obtain better harvests. He sells his harvests in the places surrounding his community. He has a lot of customers who prefer him because of the quality, good prices and above all the good service. José needs to invest and that is why he is asking for a loan that will allow him to buy corn and bean seeds, insecticide, herbicide, fertilizer, etc. José has good payment references from people he knows and he is very responsible. He is sure he will be able to pay off the loan on time and he says that it will bring financial security to his home.

loans.use: to buy corn and bean seeds, insecticide, herbicide, fertilizers, etc.

loans.name: Patricia Carolina

texts.es:
Patricia tiene 35 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene cuatro hijos. Cuenta con 10 años de experiencia en la administración de su tienda; antes se dedicaba al negocio de costureria, pero por la falta de clientes en su taller se vio obligada a iniciar con la tienda. Ella aprendió sola ya que tenia sus hijos y no tenia un empleo formal para ganarse el sustento diario, inicio vendiendo por poquitos ya que no alcanzaba a surtir su tienda, pero poco a poco ha venido creciendo para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, actualmente su tienda cuenta con todo lo necesario para atender a sus clientes. ella abre su negocio a las 5:00 de la mañana y lo cierra hasta las 9:00 de la noche.

 Para comprar los insumos de su tienda tiene que abordar un autobús en su comunidad, en el cual viaja unos 45 minutos, al llegar a la ciudad compra en una tienda de mayoreo, luego de realizar sus compras, va a abordar el bus y regresa a casa.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar un saco de frijoles, un saco de arroz, un saco de azúcar, aceite, jabón, detergentes y otros productos de uso diario, para aumentar los inventarios de su tienda y así lograr tener todo lo que sus clientes buscan, para lograr mantenerlos satisfechos. Ademas, de tener mercadería variada y así sus clientes encontraran lo que buscan, esto ayudara a fidelisar a sus clientes y sus ingresos estarán seguros.

 Patricia planea, comprar maquinas de coser e instalar su taller de costura, para trabajarle a algunos bazares, ya que ella sabe de  alta costura.
texts.en: Patricia is 35 years old. She lives with her partner and has four children. She is very experienced at managing her business, which she has had for ten years. Before opening this shop, she was a seamstress, but did not have enough customers to make a living from that trade alone. She learned how to manage a shop entirely on her own, since she had to take care of her children and did not have a steady income on which to live. At first, she had problems finding merchandise, so she started out on a very small scale. However, she has since managed to grow gradually, in order to meet customer demand. Nowadays, the shop has everything a customer needs, and is open from 5 in the morning to 9 in the evening. In order to buy supplies for her shop, Patricia needs to take a bus ride from where she lives to the city, which is approximately 45 minutes away. There, she buys what she needs in a wholesale shop, and takes the bus back home. The loan she asks for is to buy a sack of broad beans, a sack of rice, a sack of sugar, cooking oil, soap, detergent, and other everyday products, in order to renew her stock and keep satisfying her customers. Moreover, the more varied the merchandise she sells, the more customers are likely to become regulars, which will provide Patricia with a steady income. She plans to buy sewing machines and to have her own workshop in order to fulfill orders from some retail shops, since she is, after all, a qualified seamstress.

loans.use: to buy various everyday products to sell at her shop.

loans.name: Shpresa

texts.en:
Shpresa is a married Egyptian Albanian in her early 50s with no children. She lives with her husband in a little town in the northern part of the country where there are not very many members of her community. Life in this town is very difficult and poverty is a main issue with almost no employment opportunities for the youngsters and also for people of her age, according to Shpresa. 

Shpresa considers herself lucky to have her husband working and bringing home a little income for both of them. Yet now she wants to start her own activity to help out financially: buying and reselling used clothes just like many of the members of her community. This is a fun activity, according to her, that she will really enjoy. “For as long as poverty will be an issue in Albania, this type of activity will exist and thrive. I see it in my community that whoever does it has no regrets about it,” Shpresa said.

Kindly note that it was not possible to take a picture of Shpresa at her activity, since she is expecting to start with this loan, should she be financed through Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy second-hand clothing to resell.

loans.name: Ana Yolanda

texts.es: Ana de 38 años de edad es una persona muy amable, responsable y trabajadora, vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos quienes estudian actualmente y su esposo que es agricultor, ella posee un negocio en el mercado que está cerca de su lugar de residencia de productos de primera necesidad como granos básicos, aceite, macarrones, fideos, detergentes, papel higiénico, etc. desde hace 5 años tiene mucha clientela por tener su negocio muy surtido con las ganancias que obtiene y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Ana está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mercadería por mayor y surtir mas su negocio y así obtener mejores ganancias para darel a su familia una mejor vida.
texts.en: Ana, a very nice, responsible, and hard-working person, is 38 years old. She lives in a house of her own with her three children, who are students, and her husband, a farmer by trade. She owns a shop in a market town not far from where she lives, where she sells first-necessity products such as basic grains, cooking oil, macaroni, noodles, detergent, toilet paper, etc. She has had this business for five years and the number of customers keeps rising, because she takes care to devote part of the profits to keeping the shop well-stocked. The rest of the profits, together with her husband's income, go towards paying for household expenses. Ana asks for a loan in order to buy merchandise wholesale for her shop, in the hope that offering more products will generate more income that will help improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy merchandise wholesale for her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm tools.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beer, soda, sugar and rice to sell.

loans.name: Emmanuel Antonio

texts.es:
Emmanuel tiene 24 años de edad, esta acompañado. Posee mucha experiencia en la actividad  que realiza (venta de helados) ya que toda su vida se ha dedicado a dicha actividad, la aprendió de sus padres y lo sigue ejerciendo por ahora por su propia cuenta. Posee una motocicleta y una tricimoto, en ambas sale a vender helados, paga a una persona para que le ayude. Viaja 8 kilómetros, en su motocicleta hasta llegar a la ciudad en donde compra la mercadería (helados) luego se regresa a las comunidades del municipio a vender los helados casa por casa. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para realizarle un ajuste a la tricimoto y para comprar más helados de distinta variedad. Por el momento, solo esta trabajando con la motocicleta, porque la tricimoto esta desajustada y la venta ha bajado por esta razón. 

Gracias al préstamo, podrá mejorar su medio de transporte el cual utiliza para hacer sus ventas diarias y generar los ingresos económicos  para su familia y para seguir mejorando su negocio el cual planea hacerlo mas grande y con mas rutas.

Su primera proyección es comprar donde vivir y construir su vivienda propia y hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Emmanuel is 24 years old and married. He has a lot of experience iin his activity (selling ice cream). He has dedicated his life to this activity. He learned it from his parents and still does it now on his own. He has a motorcycle and a tri-motorcycle and he sells ice cream from both. He pays someone to help him. He travels 8 kilometers on his motorcycle to get to the city where he buys the merchandise (ice cream). Later he returns to the communities of the town to sell the ice cream house to house. 

The loan he is asking Fundación Campo for is to do an adjustment on the tri-motorcycle and to buy more ice cream in different varieties. Right now, he is only working the motorcycle because the tri-motorcycle is misadjusted and sales have fallen because of this.

Thanks to the loan, he cam improve his transport he uses to sell every day and generate income for his family to keep improving his business. He plans to make it bigger and with more routes. 

His first project is to buy a place to live and build a house and make his business grow.

loans.use: to do an adjustment on his tri-motorcycle and buy different types of ice cream.

loans.name: Boko Group

texts.en:
Masudi, who is in his mid 20s, is single. For four years now, Masudi has been managing a food shop business. He is doing fine with his enterprise. He starts working from 6 a.m. to 11 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair profit per month. 

This will be his first loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. He will use this loan to buy more food so as to sell more. He dreams that one day he will be able to sell more food products in his business. Masudi will share this loan with his loan group "Boko," which totals five members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more food so as to sell more.

loans.name: Pedson

texts.en: Pedson is a 48-year-old married man with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. He deals in a clothing business alongside earning a salary as a civil servant. Hardworking as he is, he began the business to support his family and educate his children. He dreams of educating his children to higher levels  of education despite the challenges of stiff competition. Pedson intends to use the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 25-year-old single man living in Sana`a, Yemen. He has made a lot of effort to provide for his family. He dreams of a better future and brighter world to surround him, but life in Yemen where he lives is full of challenges and difficulties. He came to think that the only way to secure his future was to establish his own micro-enterprise. He has had a grocery store for four years. 

Sometimes, his business is not running well due to having nothing of what his customers need. He would like to enlarge his business to increase his profit, but he doesn't have more money. So, he is taking a loan of 250,000 YER (Yemen rials) from AMB in order to purchase grocery items and other goods required by his customers.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items and other goods required by his customers.

loans.name: Vibula Mbagara Group

texts.en:
Mwajaa, who is in her early 30s, is single with five children of whom three are in school and two are young. 

For years now, Mwajaa has been managing her family by running a business selling soft drinks and beer. She works from 8 a.m. to 11 at night daily and is able to make a good return per month.

This will be her fourth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to restock more drinks, which she sold to more customers. With the profit from the business, she bought land, where she expects to build a house. She also covered household expenses and school fees. 

Mwajaa has paid back all her previous loans successfully. She will use this loan to buy more drinks to resell. She dreams to improve her business by having a better working environment.

She will share this loan with her loan group, "Vibula Mbagara," which consists of nine members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more drinks to resell.

loans.name: Mayranush

texts.en:
Mayranush lives in Ayntap village in the Ararat region of Armenia with her husband and son. Mayranush and her husband run a farm, where they keep chickens along with cultivating different types of fruits and vegetables (tomatoes, greens, apples, cherries, plums and apricots). 

Mayranush has applied for this loan to purchase fertilizer and seeds and hire workers for gathering the harvest. Implementation of these goals is important for Mayranush to have sufficient income from the sales of the harvest to sustain her family during the year. 

Mayranush and her family wait for your support!

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and seeds and hire workers to gather the harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock of fish.

loans.name: Meshack

texts.en:
Meshack lives in Malindi, Kenya, where he runs a motorcycle-transport business. He has done this business for the last four years and it is doing great.  He has three employees in this business and pays them. This is his only economic activity and source of income for the family. His ambition is to be running public service vehicles in the next five years. 

He knew Milango through friends, and he decided to join. He is married and blessed with one child. 

He seeks a loan to repair one of his motorcycles and pay insurance fees for all the motorcycles. The income that he raises from the business improves his standards of living, and he will pay school fees for his child.

loans.use: to repair one motorcycle and pay insurance fees.

loans.name: Imad

texts.en:
Imad is a 39-year-old married man, living in a village in Mount Lebanon. His wife is a school teacher in one of the neighboring schools. 

He is the owner of a small restaurant in his village, which has been his major financial resource for four years. Imad decided to contact Al Majmoua and acquire a loan in order to purchase a new "shawarma" machine (Shawarma is a meat preparation where meat is mixed and placed on a vertical rotating spit to be grilled for as long as a day). This will enhance his working capital and enlarge the range of foods he offers to his customers. 

In the future, Imad hopes that the situation of the country will get better in order for him to be able to open up a second branch.

loans.use: to purchase a new "shawarma" machine.

loans.name: Liana

texts.en:
A teacher since 2005, Liana has been involved in agriculture for many years. She lives with her husband, her mother-in-law and two school age-children in the small village of Khdranc. 

In order to overcome financial difficulties, the family started to breed cattle years ago. Now, due to their hard work, they keep livestock that includes chickens, pigs and calves.
 
As a teacher's salary in the village is not enough for covering the family's costs, agriculture is the only other source of income for Liana and her family members.
Now, with a lot of plans, Liana has applied for this loan to increase her livestock with two cows and a calf. She hopes that Kiva lenders will support her farming business and the loan will help the family to live a better life.

loans.use: to pay for two cows and a calf.

loans.name: Orlando Antonio

texts.es: Orlando, a sus 40 años de edad es padre de 2 hijos y vive en unión libre con su pareja. Toda su vida la ha pasado en el campo, donde aprendió las labores agropecuarias, gracias a las enseñanzas de su padre. Desde muy joven empezó a trabajar en diversas actividades, para conseguir todo lo que para él era necesario, de esta manera fue adquiriendo experiencia y actualmente se dedica a la actividad ganadera y a la siembra de cultivos, labores que le generan los ingresos suficientes para llevar el sustento a su hogar. Orlando es un hombre juicioso, trabajador, pujante y siempre va en busca de opciones que le permitan salir adelante, por esa razón se motiva a solicitar el crédito, con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de ganado de levante (crías de ternera) con el fin de cuidarlos y engordarlos para luego venderlos a un mejor precio de acuerdo a los kilos que pese el animal, esto le permitirá aumentar sus ingresos, con lo que podrá brindarle a su familia una estabilidad económica, mejor educación a sus hijos y mejorará la calidad de vida de toda la familia.
texts.en: Orlando is 40 years old, is the father of two children, and has a common-law marriage with his partner. He has spent his entire life in the country, where he learned agricultural work thanks to the teachings of his father.  From the time he was very young he began working in various activities in order to obtain what was necessary. In this way he acquired experience and currently he works raising livestock and raising crops, labors that generate sufficient income to maintain his household. Orlando is a wise man, a hard worker, with great strength, and one who always looks for options that will allow him to move forward.  For this reason he is asking for a loan, with the aim of investing in the purchase of livestock like calves and heifers, with the goal of raising and fattening them in order to sell them at a better price according to the weight of each animal. This will allow him to increase his earnings, which will provide his family with economic stability, a better education for his children, and a better quality of life for the whole family.

loans.use: To purchase livestock like heifers and calves.

loans.name: Juan Santos

texts.es:
Juan es un hombre de 44 años de edad, acompañado y padre de dos hijos.  Posee mucha experiencia en la actividad  que realiza (agricultura) también es propietario de una yunta de bueyes con los cuales en invierno trabaja en las milpas y en el verano transporta agua en carreta a los amigos y vecinos de los cuales revise una paga; sin embargo toda su vida se ha dedicado a dicha actividad ya que la aprendió de sus padres y lo sigue haciendo hoy por su propia cuenta 

El crédito sera utilizado en la compra de insumos agrícolas (abono y herbicidas) y otra parte sera para surtir un pequeño negocio  de venta de ropa ambulante que tiene su compañera de vida. 

Con el préstamo, proporcionara un mejor beneficio a su cultivo del cual espera tener mayor producción el cual obteniendo mejor producción tendrá mejores ingresos para su familia y podrá cancelar su crédito ademas podrá invertir mas en el negocio de ropa, la cual tan bien genera ingresos a la  familia.

Su primera proyección, es  construir su vivienda propia y hacer crecer el negocio de su compañera de vida; también poderles dar una educación a sus 2 hijos.
texts.en:
Juan is a 44 year old man. He is married and the father of two children. He has a lot of experience in his activity (farming). He is also the owner a team of oxen that he works corn with in the winter and in the summer he hauls water to friends and neighbors from whom he receives payment. He learned this activity from his parents and he continues doing it on his own. 

The loan will be used to buy agricultural materials (fertilizer and herbicides). Another part of it will be used to stock a small business selling clothes as a street vendor that his life's companion has. 

With the loan, he will provide a benefit to his crop from which he hopes to have a bigger yield. He will have more income for his family and he will be able to  pay off the loan. He will also be able to invest more in the clothes selling business, which also generates money for his family.  

HIs first goal is building his own house, growing his life's companion's business and also giving his 2 children and education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicide. Another part will be used to stock a small business selling clothes as a street vendor that his life's companion has.

loans.name: Jeannine Priscille

texts.fr: Jeannine est une femme de 28 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. elle possède et gère un salon de coiffure dans un quartier de la ville depuis 10 ans. elle sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer son stock de marchandises en achetant des mèches, afin de lui permettre d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaires et ses bénéfices. les bénéfices générés vont être injecter dans son capital d'une part et assurer l'avenir de ses enfants d'autre part
texts.en: Jeannine is a 28-year-old woman who is a married mother of three children. She has owned and managed a hair salon in a district in the city for ten years. She is requesting this loan to bolster her stock of merchandise by purchasing some hair extensions in order to increase her sales and profits. The profits earned will be add to her capital, as well as be used to assure her children's future.

loans.use: to purchase hair extensions to sell in her salon

loans.name: Nissan Group

texts.en:
Maida, who is in her early 30s, is single and has two children who are in school. 

For three years now, she has been managing an enterprise of automotive spare parts. Maida works from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair profit per month. 

This will be her tenth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. With the previous loans, all of which she repaid successfully, she opened her current spare parts business and bought more spares. Maida used the business profit to cover home expenses, school fees and plough back to her business.
