Hermes is asking for a loan to buy materials for the shop like hair coloring, scissors, brushes, powder, and alcohol. With these supplies, he hopes that he will be able to improve his business as well as his income.

loans.use: to buy materials for his shop

loans.name: Joedemi

texts.en: Joedemi is 40 years old and lives in Labo Ozamiz City. She is married and has one adult and two school-age children. Joedemi has a retail business from which she earns approximately PHP 6,000 each month. She has applied for a loan to buy a one-unit motorcycle which will be used in the transport and delivery of purchased items. Joedemi has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Joedemi hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
This is Letecia. She previously accessed a 25,000 PHP loan that she utilized to buy gardening materials and supplies needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would now like to apply for a 30,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy gardening materials like wire and baskets and supplies such as seed and fertilizer needed in her business. Her profits from his business will definitely help her cover their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Letecia's hope is for her business to grow bigger and to have a better living. Letecia meets up weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for gardening materials like wire and baskets and supplies such as seed and fertilizers to be used in her business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is taking a loan of $600 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She has a shop to generate income for her family. She has been thinking about how to run a big business, but she does not have enough working capital. She felt better when she applied for her first loan. She will buy some additional supplies to keep in her store such as T-shirts, blouses, shorts, pants and other items. She is happy that TRM offers loans to poor people.

loans.use: to buy T-shirts, blouses, shorts, pants and other items.

loans.name: Abdulqader

texts.en:
Abdulqader is 25 years old. He lives in Amman, Jordan. He has one sister. Abdulqader is a third-year student, studying for a Bachelor of Mobile Systems Management. He also works in the Education Ministry. One of the obstacles that Abdulqader has faced is the increase of his study fees. Now, he is seeking a loan to pay his study fees.

 He is planning to expand his study and get a higher degree, in the future.

loans.use: To pay his study fees

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en:
Habiba is 35 years old, married with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  

Habiba has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. Habiba requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fish to make dried fish.

Habiba has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Habiba would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

Note: she is a Muslim in religion and covering their face is part of her culture.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Adjoavi

texts.fr: Cette femme est mariée et mère de 03 enfants, elle vit avec sa famille dans le quartier d’ Agoé qui est un quartier au nord de la ville de Lomé, elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu la restauration (cafétariat). Elle exerce ce commerce dans une boutique. Le stock dont elle dispose présentement ne lui permet pas de satisfaire ses clients, elle sollicite de WAGES un quatrième crédit pour acheter des boites de lait, de sucre, des œufs... Elle souhaite agrandir son activité et assurer les besoins vitaux de la famille.
texts.en: This is a married woman and mother of three. She lives with her family in a district in Agoé, which is located north of the city of Lomé. She has a restaurant (cafeteria), a revenue-generating business. She operates it in a shop. The stock of supplies she has at present does not allow her to satisfy her customers. She is requesting a fourth loan from WAGES to purchase containers of milk, sugar, eggs, …  She would like to expand her business and ensure her family's vital needs are met.

loans.use: to purchase food supplies for her cafeteria

loans.name: Jerson

texts.en:
Jerson is 47 years old and lives in San Pablo, Dumingag, Zamboanga del Sur. He is married with three children.

Jerson has a shop and a traveling rice mill from which he sells rice. He has had this business for 20 years. He requested a loan to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Jerson has been a member of PMPC for almost two months. In the future, Jerson hopes to expand his business and his lifestyle.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

location.town: Molave - San Pablo, Dumingag,  Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad is 56 years old, married and has worked as a tailor for many years. She enjoys her business a lot. Though she is already old, still she has been able to manage her business and has raised her children through it. 

Trinidad plans to have her own tailoring shop someday where she can display all her tailored curtains, unlike now. Now she only brings her samples to the market, and there she sells her finished products to have sales. 

She is highly motivated to improve her enterprise in order to increase her income. Thus, Trinidad is now requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy needles, thread and material to make curtains to sell. She hopes to make her dream come true through her hard work and patience in managing her business.

loans.use: to buy needles, thread and material to make curtains to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: 01.06.06 Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Anh is applying for a loan to purchase household commodities in general to resell. She has a retail business selling general things. Anh is 37 years old and she is married with two children. Anh is the group leader of the 01.06.06 Đông Hải solidarity group, which consists of five members. 

In 2011, Anh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Anh has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Anh has been involved in this business for six years. The main hardship that Anh faces in her business is lack of capital.

Using her business profit, Anh hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase  household commodities in general to resell

loans.name: María Teresa

texts.es: La cliente corresponde al sector de Suburbio en Guayaquil.  Empezó años atrás vendiendo confitería de manera ambulante, en donde le fue muy bien.  Luego de esto, montó una tienda y además se dedicó a vender lotería y ya lleva realizándolo por 15 años.  Ahora cuenta con una buena clientela que le compran diaria o semanalmente.  Distribuye su labor en la mañana vendiendo lotería y en la tarde atendiendo el negocio de la tienda con la ayuda de sus hijos.  Es separada desde hace 13 años y tiene 3 hijos de 18, 15 y 13 años; quienes estudian en el establecimiento fiscal.  Ahora necesita el préstamo para invertirlo en lotería y artículos/víveres para su tienda.
texts.en: This client is from the Suburbio sector of Guayaquil.  She started years ago selling snacks from place to place and did very well.  After this, she set up a store and also sold lottery tickets and has been doing this for 15 years.  She now has a good clientele that buy from her daily or weekly.  She spends mornings selling lottery tickets and afternoons tending to the store with help from her children.  She’s been separated for the last 13 years and has three children who are 18, 15 and 13 years of age who attend local public schools.  She needs a loan now to buy lottery tickets and stock merchandise for her store.

loans.use: to buy lottery tickets and stock merchandise for the store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to clear weeds.

loans.name: Jeason

texts.en: Jeason is single and lives in Molatuhan, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. His parents earn a living from farming, and he helped them by working on the farm on weekends. Despite the financial hindrance, Jeason is still going to pursue his dream of finishing his studies. He took a loan from Gata Daku MPC to cover the costs of school tuition and study materials. He hopes that after this, he will be able to work in any company related to his course.

loans.use: to cover the costs of school tuition and materials

loans.name: Gerson Javier

texts.es:
Gerson, vive con su familia en casa propia, su esposa y su hija, asimismo con un hermano mayor. El, se dedica a la agricultura, siembra de maíz, lo hace desde hace mucho tiempo atrás y desde cuando era pequeño, ya que su padre le inculco el oficio. 
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar los insumos agrícolas necesarios, tales como: abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, insecticidas, plaguicidas, semilla, entre otros; esta inversión le ayudara a seguir creciendo el inventario y obtener mejores resultados, asimismo mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
Su sueño es hacerle mejoras a su vivienda para vivir mas confortable.
texts.en:
Gerson lives with his family, his wife and daughter, as well as an older brother, in his own home. He makes a living through agriculture. He sows corn. He has done so for many years and since he was little, since his father instilled the profession in him.

The loan that he is requesting will allow him to buy necessary agricultural supplies, such as: fertilizer, herbicide, pesticide, insecticide, seeds, among others. This loan will allow him to continue growing the inventory and obtain better results, and additionally improve his family’s quality of life.

His dream is to improve his home to live more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicide, pesticide, insecticide, seeds, among others.

loans.name: Creatifa Group

texts.en:
Rosalina is one the members from Greatifa Group and the word "Greatifa" is in a lokal language, 
that means" Hope"
She is taking the loan to add more her own working capital in order to buy some additional supplies such as flowers and wood.she is a hard working woman. she started her business a year ago with her own working capital of $ 60.00 dollars.

loans.use: to buy flowers and wood

loans.name: Silvio

texts.es: Don Silvio es habitante del barrio Laureles Sur, una zona marginal de Managua, su esposa hace tortillas en la casa y las vende, el siempre con su labor como guara de seguridad, de esta manera apoyan a sus hijos que son adolecentes y continúan estudiando. Este crédito que solicita don Silvio es para instalar servicios higiénicos y empezar a  hacer un anexo a la casa, de esta manera espera ir poco a poco haciéndole las mejoras a su vivienda para el bienestar de su familia y sobre todo tener higiene en el hogar.
texts.en:
Silvio is a resident of the Laureles Sur neighborhood, a peripheral district of Managua. His wife makes tortillas at home and sells them. He works as a security guard. In this way, they support their children, who are adolescents and continue studying.

This loan that Silvio is requesting is to install a bathroom and begin to make an annex to the house. In this way, he hopes to go little by little making improvements to his home for the well-being of his family, and above all to have hygiene in the home.

loans.use: to buy iron, cement, cement blocks, sand, and a toilet.

loans.name: Philcioner

texts.en: Philcioner is a kiva borrower who describes herself as obedient. She has taken a loan of KES 20,000 to buy a water tank that will benefit eight family members. The family faces a challenge of access to clean water. The tank will enable them to harvest rain water for domestic use. She runs a grocery store where she sells bananas, oranges, etc. to earn an income. She hopes that in the future she will purchase a bigger tank. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy a water tank

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is married and has five children.  She operates a sari-sari or variety store selling various items to the people in her neighborhood. 

Lorna is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy more stocks of canned goods, candies, soda, noodles, biscuits, snack foods, and cooking ingredients. With this loan, Lorna can expand the diversity of items at her store thus attracting more customers and buyers.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, candies, soda, noodles, biscuits, snack foods, and cooking ingredients

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
This is Susan, 32, a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Alex, an employee, and a mother to her children. Together with her husband she manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.
 
Susan operates a food stall. She sells snacks like banana cue. Banana cue is a popular snack food in the Philippines of deep fried bananas coated in caramelized brown sugar. Banana cue is made from Saba bananas. It is usually skewered on a bamboo stick, and is sold on the streets. She also sells different juices like gelatin juice and coconut juice. She is also a coconut dealer.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 3000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more coconut, bananas and other ingredients needed in her food stall.

Susan hopes to have more stalls and dreams of having a vacation with her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more coconut, bananas and other ingredients needed in her food stall.

loans.name: Levy

texts.en:
Levy works hard to support her family. She is married and has a turmeric tea business in the Philippines.

Levy requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional raw materials like sugar, turmeric, ginger, plastic for packing etc..
.
Levy has been in this business for 5 years now and earn additional income from farming sugarcane.

In the future, Levy would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw materials like sugar, turmeric, ginger, plastic for packing etc..

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional fishing materials for her fishing business.

Marilyn has been in this business for four years. She earns additional income from a general store.

She successfully paid off her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. She decided to change her business because these new businesses can earn a bigger income to sustain the needs of her family but she will be engage again in her previous businesses if she can find that can generate income not losses for her family.

Marilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy coffee plants to replant part of his farm.

loans.name: Edgar Omar

texts.es:
Edgar, tiene 41 años de edad, vive con su familia que la conforma su esposa de 40 años de edad  y sus dos hijos. Edgar, se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de pipián y maíz, oficio que lo aprendió con sus padres, ya que el manifiesta que desde pequeño el acompañaba a sus padres al campo.
El préstamo que solicita lo utilizara para compra de insumos agrícolas, tales como: abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, insecticidas, plaguicidas y de esa manera poder preparar la tierra para que su cultivo sea muy productivo y obtener una buena cosecha, asimismo de esta forma  poder obtener y gozar de muy buenos ingresos.
Su mayor sueño es fortalecer mas el negocio y  brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su grupo familiar.
texts.en:
Edgar, 41, lives with his family consisting of his 40-year-old wife and their two children.  Edgar works in agriculture, specifically growing pumpkins and corn; an occupation he learned from his parents since he relates that he accompanied his parents in the fields when since he was little.

The loan he’s asking for will be used to buy agricultural supplies like manure, herbicide, pesticide, insecticide and fungicide in order to prepare the soil so that his crop will be productive and crop yield will be good.  Similarly, in this way he will be able to earn and enjoy very good income too.  His greatest dream is to strengthen the business more and to provide his family group with better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Jatu

texts.en:
Meet 30-year-old Jatu, from Waterloo, a western, rural area in Freetown. She is married, with two children between the ages of three and eight years old. Her children are currently attending school. 

In 2007, Jatu established her clothing business. She began her business because she needed to create income to support the home. She works at the business 12 hours per day and seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of sufficient capital to run her business.

Jatu requires a loan in order to buy more varieties of clothing material, to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and have a permanent business location. 

In the future, Jatu plans to own a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more varieties of clothing material, to expand her business.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
For most people in Rwanda, electricity is a luxury.  Seated just south of the equator, the Rwandan sky is pitch-black each evening at 6pm, and seeing lights glowing from inside a home is a rarity. 

In Rwanda, just 11% of people have access to electricity, which means 8 million rural households use smoky, asthma-inducing and inefficient kerosene to light their homes. Without access to reliable energy, children often walk for hours to gather firewood instead of attending school, and adults lack reliable ways to charge the phones that keep them in touch with family or the market. Light for homework becomes prohibitively expensive, and rural hospital power outages put lives in danger. 

Rwanda-based Great Lakes Energy (GLE) provides low-cost and environmentally friendly solar energy products that bring electricity to those most in need, but they need your support to improve their reach to the most vulnerable.  

Founded by Sam, an American who has been living in Rwanda for the past decade, GLE and its team of Rwandans provides clean electricity to rural consumers, healthcare centers, orphanages and schools throughout Rwanda. 

Currently, the team runs its Rwanda-wide operations using outdated paper systems and a few old computers.  Up until now, GLE has focused its investments solely on its solar products, improving technologies to drive down costs for their consumers.  However, with outdated systems and IT equipment, GLE is struggling to keep up with existing clients and meet the demands of new clients in the larger market.

Right now, when the team installs solar panels at rural hospitals to give doctors access to stable light to perform examinations and patients access to life-saving machines, they plan installations on paper drawings and schedules because their computers are too unreliable to take to the field.  Detailed records are extremely difficult to maintain, risking missing vital maintenance checks, which can derail the promise of the solar light.  With extra time spent keeping paper records, they are diverting key resources away from spreading access to electricity.  

GLE is looking for new funding to purchase much needed IT equipment. This will allow the team to use engineering tablets and notepads to produce real-time drawings and electrical specifications. This increased efficiency will allow GLE to help more Rwandans access power, hire more local labor, and serve their customers more efficiently and accurately.  

This business innovation has real impact on people’s lives: supporting GLE means supporting more rural Rwandan families to tap into the benefits of electricity that are still out of reach for too many.   With solar, health improves.  Education improves.  Rwandans save several days of earnings each month on not purchasing CO2-emitting kerosene. 

But more than anything else, individual families can access the means to create better lives for themselves and their children.

loans.use: To purchase updated IT equipment so that this solar company can better service and access rural customers

loans.name: Agustinus

texts.en:
Agustinus desires to go to school - so he hopes - but, due to the condition of his poor parents, Agustinus has concerns. Agustinus lives in the Aru Islands, specifically in the town of Dobo, Ambon, Maluku. Both his parents work as farmers. Their income is erratic and only enough for everyday living expenses. So far, Agustinus has helped his parents. He is the third of three siblings. Agustinus is currently one of the students who will be studying at the Academy of Maritime Nusantara. He chose the Commerce program, Harbour Management and Administration, because, with his ability and his ideals, he can work in the office of the National Transportation Agency. Because he does not want to burden his parents, Agustinus applied for a loan to Kiva to cover the cost of his studies.

Agustinus is very grateful to the lenders who will help him with his studies, although not known to him.

loans.use: To pay education fees for three years

loans.name: Rafelly

texts.en:
Rafelly is a prospective student of the Nusantara Maritime Academy. The program he will take is the Management Commerce and Harbour Administration. Rafelly wants to become an expert in the field of shipping and administration so he can work in the port. Rafelly is the first child of four siblings from the island of Batam. Batam Island, including the island provinces; namely Riau Islands, is located on the west side of Indonesia. His father works as a self-employed labourer with no fixed income. Rafelly hopes to obtain a loan from Kiva investors. He wants to finish his education with no problems so he can ease the burden on his parents who finance his life. He wants to quickly get a job in order to finance schooling for his two sisters and one brother.

Rafelly is very grateful to Kiva investors who help finance his studies.

loans.use: To pay education fees for three years

loans.name: Daud

texts.en: Commercial Shipping and Harbor Management is the study program selected by Daud. Currently he is a prospective student at the Academy of Maritime Nusantara (AMN) in Cilacap. He is eager to work in a shipping company or at a major port in Indonesia. Daud's parents are very supportive and eager to help Daud complete his education. Daud's father is only a farmer, whose income is uncertain. Sometimes, to meet daily needs, Daud must borrow from neighbors or relatives of his parents. Daud is the second child of two siblings. His sister helps his father to farm the fields. Daud hopes to obtain a student loan from Kiva to ease the burden on his parents. Daud thanks lenders around the world, although not personally know to him.

loans.use: To pay education fees for three years

loans.name: Taiana

texts.en:
Taiana is 45 years old and married with six children. She has a small garden where she grows taro, cabbages, tomatoes, and taamu that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for  two years. 

Taiana  needs a loan to buy chemicals, a backpack sprayer, bush-knives, a file, fertilizer, gloves and boots. She became a member of SPBD in 2013. Taiana will use the profits from her sales to renovate her house and to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a backpack sprayer, bush-knives, a file, fertilizer, gloves and boots

loans.name: Masyurianto

texts.en:
Gets large orders, Masyurianto re-applying for loans to MUK. With new loan of 5M IDR, Masyuarianto will buy wood, cement, brick, stone and other necessities to build a house like nails, saws, hammers and others. He buy all that materials and sell it again to his customers who build a house. He take the materials from a large store and escort it to his customers. He will get directly payment.
With pursue this business, Masyurianto hoping to get satisfactory results. He could meet the needs of the family and he has a plan to buy a better car to support his efforts. To support the plan, all profits will be save.

loans.use: to buy wood, cement, brick, stone and other necessities to build a house like nails, saws, hammers and others

loans.name: Mayela Suyen

texts.es: La señora Mayela, habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su esposo e hijos, sus planes a futuro es poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida, el esposo de doña Mayela tiene un taller de Refrigeracion y ella vende frutas y verduras, con este credito compraran materiales para realizar un cuarto donde puedan tener el taller ya que esta al aire libre y ellos desena tener mayor suguridad, ya que temen que se les lleven algun repuesto, comprara: Cemento, Bloques, Hierro, Arena, Piedrin, etc. Agradece el apoyo que Afodenic y Fondos Kiva le han brindado hasta ahora.
texts.en:
Mayela lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe with her husband and children.  Her future plan is to be able to improve her living conditions.  Mayela’s husband has a refrigerator repair shop and she sells fruit and vegetables.

They will use this loan to buy building supplies to build a room where they can install the workshop because it’s currently open-air and they want to have more security because they fear having replacement parts stolen.  She will buy cement, blocks, iron, sand, gravel, etc.  She is grateful for the support Afodenic and Kiva funds have provided her to date.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es: Doña Raquel habitante del barrio Laureles Sur, su esposo se dedica a la venta de electrodomésticos, ahora ella tiene otro integrante más de la familia un hijo de 8 meses de nacido. Solicita el crédito para hacer instalación nueva del sistema eléctrico de su casa para el ahorro de energía, pondrá bujías ahorrativas con el objetivo de disminuir los gastos del hogar y esta es la manera de empezar a hacerlo para Raquel. Quedando pendientes aun varias mejoras como repello de paredes, piso, entre otros que hará poco a poco debido a sus bajos recursos económicos que le genera su empleo como docente de secundaria.
texts.en: Raquel lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood.  Her husband works selling home appliances and the family has a new member, an 8-month-old son.  She’s requesting the loan to install new electric wiring at home to save on electricity costs.  She will install energy-saving light bulbs in order to reduce household costs and this is how Raquel intends to start doing so.  There are still some other things pending like plastering the walls and installing flooring, among others but she’ll do those little by little due to the low economic resources she earns as a secondary school teacher.

loans.use: to buy electrical wiring, breakers, plugs, accessories and light bulbs.

loans.name: Nedilyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, two of whom are in school, Nedilyn works hard to support her family.

She buys and sells peanuts in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Nedilyn is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of peanuts to sell for her business.

Nedilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of peanuts to sell

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en:
Criselda is 38 years old and married. Criselda has four children who are all in school.

Criselda is in the agricultural business. She raises pigs in the Philippines. Criselda requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Criselda has been raising pigs for seven years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Criselda would like to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en: Luzviminda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business general store business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like can goods, milk, sugar, chips, noodles, etc.. Luzviminda has been in this business for 8 years. She earns additional income from food vending, buy and sell charcoal and selling bamboo. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like can goods, milk, sugar, chips, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Avito

texts.en:
Avito is a fish and other seafood products vendor from the town of Panglao, Bohol. He is a married man and has three children ages 11, 10 and 9. Avito has been in the business for more than 10 years now. This is the source of his income.

Avito is asking for a loan to buy more fish and other seafood products to sell. With this, he will be able to improve his sales as well as his income. Moreover, Avito dreams of becoming a successful businessman someday. He added that he wants to save money for the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy more fish and other seafood products to sell

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 30 years old, and married with two children.  After dropping out of school due to lack of school fees, Richard went into agriculture, mainly sugarcane growing, as a way of getting money to look after himself and it has helped him change his life.  

Richard received a loan of 500,000 shillings to buy sugarcane plantations for brewing waragi (an alcoholic drink) and he has completed paying for the land.

Richard now wants another loan of 800,000 shillings to rent land for growing sugarcane. 

His dream is to acquire more land so that he can grow more of his own sugarcane, rather than renting the land. He also wants to buy his own machine to thresh the sugarcane.

loans.use: To rent land for growing sugar cane

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to increase production.

loans.name: Alisa

texts.en:
Alisa is from Ashotavan village of Syuniq region, where she lives with her husband and school-aged son. The region where the family lives is famous for its severe climate, so locals here are mostly involved in cattle breeding and some land cultivation. Alisa has been involved in agriculture for many years. She raises cattle, keeps five colonies of bees, and cultivates several kinds of fruits and vegetables (potato, apple, plum, and pear). Alisa's only income comes from agriculture, so the farming business is very important for her and her family.

Now, this hardworking woman with a great credit history behind her is requesting a loan. She needs the loan for purchasing 10 colonies of bees, some calves, and fuel for transporting the harvest to the market. Alisa wants to increase the production of honey, and for that she needs to increase the number of bee colonies. Implementation of these goals is very important, for her to enlarge her farm and make her family's life better.

loans.use: to pay for 10 colonies of bees, some calves, and fuel for transporting the harvest to the market

loans.name: Samiya

texts.en:
Samiya is a seamstress from Shaab. She has a business providing sewing and alteration services. When Samiya has specialty jobs, or several jobs at once, she currently rents sewing machines. Having her own machines would enable Samiya to handle more customers and complete the work more quickly.

Samiya needs this loan to enable her to buy specialized sewing machines. She wants to open a shop located outside her home one day, and she wants to be able to send her sons abroad to study.

loans.use: To buy specialized sewing machines.

loans.name: Octavianus

texts.en: Octavianus is a student who will study nautical courses on a campus of the Academy Maritime Nusantara. He comes from a small village located on the outskirts of the Kapuas River, the largest river in Kalimantan, precisely Sejiram village, Kapuas Hulu, West Kalimantan. Octavianus is the first of four children whose parents work as rubber farmers. Given that their economic conditions are not enough, Octavianus had no plans for college because of the uncertain income of his parents who have to fund studies for three as Octavianus and his sister are still in school. Octavianus hopes, by obtaining a loan from Kiva, he can continue his studies and his dream to be a professional sailor can be realized in order to make his parents and younger siblings happy Thanks from Octavianus to Kiva lenders who have made it easy for him to achieve a better future.

loans.use: To pay education fees for three years

loans.name: Aditya

texts.en:
His goal to become a sailor has been a dream of Aditya. He currently is a prospective student at the Academy of Maritime Nusantara, with programs in Nautical science. However, the concern Aditya has is that he cannot achieve these ideals, as he's the first of four children. Due to economic factors hampering his  family, his father is employed as a construction worker in Jakarta, with a mediocre income and his mother does not have any special skills. With minimal income, Aditya's father has to feed four children and to pay the school fund. 

Aditya's parents make every effort to help Aditya achieve his desires and ideals. Through the Student Loan program from the Kiva, Aditya hopes to finish his education and get a job on a fast ship. He is very grateful to the lenders of Kiva, because thanks to their help, he can cover the cost of tuition and can continue his studies.

loans.use: To pay education fees for three years

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en: Josefa is 73 years old and lives in Upper Centro, Tudela, Philippines. She is a widow and has one one child. Josefa has a store that sells personal products. She has had this business for five years. She applied for a loan to purchase additional personal products to sell, such as detergents and beauty products. Josefa has been a member of PMPC for six years.  In the future, Josefa hopes to save for future consumption.

loans.use: to buy additional personal products to sell, such as detergents and beauty products.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma  is a widow with two children; and one of her children goes to school.  She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren). She resides in her own house, but the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent for her business premises. 

She has a business of a school canteen; she has been in this business for ten years. Fatuma also generates additional income by selling used clothes. She sells on a retail basis, six days out of every week. Her business challenges include seasonality and thieves.   

Fatuma has applied for a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bans of bread, biscuits, samosa, eggs, and beverages like packed juice.  

She aspires to educate her children up to the university level, and to build rental rooms.

loans.use: To buy more bans of bread, biscuits, samosa, eggs, and beverages like packed juice.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en: Luz is a 51-year-old resident of Mailen, Clarin. Luz provides for her six children's needs from the little amount of 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) she earns monthly from her own piggery business that she's had for three years. Aside from her piggery, she also has a service-based business providing motor transportation and rental. In 2011, she became a member of GDMPC. She requests a loan of 12,000 PHP from Gata Daku MPC to buy feeding supplies and piglets to raise. Luz wants to expand her business and be able to see her children successful.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies and piglets to raise.

loans.name: Russel

texts.en:
Russel is 42 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She grows bananas in the local community, which she has been doing for more than five years. She earns 3,000 PHP a month. 

In addition to farming, she also manages her general store, selling goods in the community to gain more income.

Russel is requesting a loan from GDMPC of 8,000 PHP, which she will use to buy rice and corn grits to sell. Her  dream is to improve her living situation.

loans.use: to buy rice and corn grits to sell

loans.name: Suyapa

texts.es:
Doña Suyapa es una mujer de 40 años de edad con un grado de educación primario cursado hasta el tercer grado y en compañía de su esposo trabajan en la agricultura en lo que el cultivo de maíz. Ella tiene una familia muy numerosa la cual está compuesta por 5 hijos dos viven con ellos bajo el mismo techo y terminaron la primaria y se involucran en las actividades del campo con sus padres. Ella tiene mucha experiencia ya que tiene más de 10 años de dedicarse a dicha actividad la cual aprendió gracias a sus padres que han sido agricultores desde siempre. La Tierra que hoy en día trabajan la han adquirido por herencia por parte de sus suegros y como todo en la vida ellos han encontrados ciertos desafíos los cuales son: la baja de precios en el mercado y los cambios climáticos (lluvias). Su tierra está a una distancia de 300 metros de su casa de habitación a la cual se trasladan a pie ya que no tienen ningún medio de transporte.

Actualmente ella solicita a COMIXMUL un financiamiento para la compra de fertilizante, abono, entre otros productos para dar mantenimiento y asistencia a sus cultivos.

Sus planes y metas como madre es seguir cultivando y comprar más ares de cultivo para que sus hijos tengan tierra para trabajar. Su sueño es ver a sus hijos en un mejor nivel de vida, con mejores oportunidades en la vida y que sean mejores cada día que pasa para con sus familias, el negocio y principalmente sus hijos.
texts.en:
Suyapa is a 40-year-old woman with a third-grade education, who in the company of her husband works in agriculture cultivating corn. She has a very large family which is made up of 5 children, two of which live with them under the same roof. They finished primary school and are involved in the farm activities with their parents.

She has a lot of experience since she has made a living for more than ten years through the aforesaid activity, which she learned thanks to her parents, who have been famers forever. The land that they currently work they have acquired through an inheritance from her in-laws. As in everything in life, they have found certain challenges, which are: low prices in the market and climatic changes (rains). Her land is at a distance of 300 meters from her home, which they go to on foot since they do not have any means of transportation.

Currently, she is applying to COMIXMUL for a loan for the purchase of fertilizer, manure, among other products for the maintenance and aid for her crops.

Her plans and goals as a mother are to continue farming and to purchase more farmland so that her children have land to work. Her dream is to see her children in a better level of life, with better opportunities in life, and that her family, the business, and mainly her children are better every day that passes.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer for her corn crops.

loans.name: Apolonali

texts.en:
Apolonali is 58 years old and married. He has four children who are all school-going, and he is in charge of paying their school fees. He is a peasant farmer, mainly growing sugarcane for brewing 'waragi,' as his major source of income to look after the family.

In the past, he borrowed a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX), which he used to begin constructing his residential house. He has paid back the loan; however, the house was not completed.

Apolonali now wants another loan, this time in the amount of 1,500,000 UGX. He will use this loan to complete construction of his residential house, so that the family can have a better place to live in.

loans.use: To complete construction of his residential house

loans.name: Richard Leonard

texts.es: El señor Richard, habita en Villa Libertad, una zona marginal de Managua, el es soltero tiene dos hijos mayores de edad, Richard es panadero desde la edad de los 13 años, ha tenido dificultades para movilizarse debido a que por causa de un accidente el perdió la pierna derecha. Solicita el crédito para aumentar la producción de pan comprando materia prima, lo cual es muy demandado por sus clientes ya que son hechos con coco, repostería típica de la Costa Atlántica de Nicaragua.De esta manera Richard desea salir adelante junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Richard lives in Villa Libertad, a marginal area of Managua.  He’s single with two adult children.  Richard has been a baker since the age of 13.  He’s had difficulty moving about because he lost his right leg in an accident.

He’s requesting the loan to increase bread production which has high customer demand because it’s made with coconut, a pastry typical of Nicaragua’s Atlantic coast.  He will buy raw materials and Richard wants to move forward with his family this way.

loans.use: to buy flour, yeast, coconut, sugar, cheese and  pineapple.

loans.name: Rudelyn

texts.en:
Rudelyn is a salted fish vendor from the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. She is a married woman and has been in the business for more than seven years now. This is the source of her income. Rudelyn is asking for a loan to buy more fish to make salted fish. 

In the future, Rudelyn hopes to expand her business and make it a success.

loans.use: to buy more fish to make salted fish

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is divorced and has 2 children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Eunice is a successful businesswoman. She sells groceries in Akatakyiwa (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about 6 years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Eunice uses her income to provide for the entire family. Eunice will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of groceries, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Eunice plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of groceries

loans.name: Amna

texts.en:
Amna owns a minimarket in Shaab. It is well run and she is slowly building up her business. In preparation for Ramadan, Amna wanted to increase her stock and begin some minor renovations.

Amna has used this loan to purchase stock and make minor renovations to her store. Her dream is to keep developing her store into a full neighborhood supermarket.

loans.use: To purchase stock and make minor renovations to her store.

loans.name: Meline

texts.en:
Meline is from Lejan village of Lori region. She is a widow and lives with her parents and is running a farm jointly with them. Their farm currently includes chickens, cows, sheep, pigs and calves. Meline also owns a plot of agricultural land where wheat and potatoes are cultivated. Despite her young age, Meline has great experience in the agricultural field and over the years of hard work now she owns a beautiful farm.

Now, by requesting this loan, Meline wants to increase her livestock by three calves and eight sheep. She dreams of having a big and profitable farm which will give her enough income to ensure a better life for her parents. 

Meline waits for your support!

loans.use: to pay for three calves and eight sheep

loans.name: Anush

texts.en:
Anush is married and has one child.  She has been a farmer for the past 10 years and has developed her farm with hard work and favorable conditions. She grows haricots, tomatoes, and different type of trees (apple, apricot, cherry, plum, pear). Anush also keeps pigs and raises cows. 

Anush is requesting a loan to cover cultivation costs and increase the number of cattle by two cows. This loan will increase her income, which is very important for meeting her family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase two cows and cover cultivation costs

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Due to difficult circumstances Esi did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Esi prepares and sells ‘Kenkey’ (a traditional Ghanaian dish made from corn dough and is wrapped in banana leaves) in her village of Akatakyiwa (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about 5 years. She is married to a mason, and together they have 3 children. Esi uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. Esi will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of maize, which will aid her in improving her overall ‘Kenkey’ sales. Esi wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of frozen foods, which will aid her in improving her overall sales.

loans.name: Cristian Andrés

texts.es: Cristian a sus 22 años de edad, es padre de 2 hijos y vive en unión libre con su pareja. Actualmente se dedica a laborar como ordeñador, pero, alterna su trabajo con la actividad ganadera, pues compra terneras de levante, las engorda y luego las vende a un mejor precio; esta actividad la aprendió de su hermano mayor y, es así como obtiene los ingresos necesarios para llevar el sustento a su hogar. El prestatario es un joven emprendedor, luchador, juicioso y dedicado a su esposa y a sus dos pequeños hijos, ellos son el motor que lo impulsa para seguir luchando en busca de opciones que le permitan progresar. Por esta razón, solicita el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de 2 terneras de levante, para darle continuidad a su negocio, y poco a poco ir avanzando hacia el cumplimiento de su principal meta, que es ser propietario de un potrero para tener más animales y de esta forma obtener mayores ingresos que le permitan dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y ofrecer un mejor bienestar y educación  a sus dos pequeños hijos.
texts.en:
Cristian, 22, is father of two children.  He’s in common law relationship.  He currently works as a milker but also works raising cattle because he buys calves to raise, fattens them up and then sells them at a better price.  He learned this activity from his older brother and this is how he earns the necessary income to support his home.  He’s a young, hardworking, prudent entrepreneur who is devoted to his wife and two small sons; they are the motor that pushes him to continue striving seeking options that will lead to progress.

Because of this he’s requesting a loan to buy two calves to raise and continue in business and gradually advance towards reaching his main goal which is to own a field so he can keep more animals thus earning higher income to provide better quality of life for his family and offer well-being and education for his two little boys.

loans.use: to buy two calves.

loans.name: Alfreda

texts.en:
Alfreda is 41 years old and lives in the Paynesville South area of Liberia. It is a suburb of the capital city of Monrovia and one of the most populated areas in Montserrado County. The area boasts one of the best standards of living in the county, with affordable rents, good roads, access to water and lots of transportation options.    

Alfreda is unmarried and has nine children between 13 and 24 years of age. The last grade she finished before getting to business is grade 6. For the past two years she has been selling charcoal in the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her mother. She enjoy her business because the it allows her to earn more money. She sells six days a week, from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m., and most of the time she used a shared taxi to get her goods to her shop. 

Alfreda is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. She plans to build a house and educate all her children.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business

loans.name: Jallal

texts.en:
Jallal is a 37-year-old married father of three children. He lives in a small village in the south of Lebanon. For the past 19 years, he has owned shops where he has sold sandwiches, vegetables, and hookahs. In 2010, he opened his current sandwich shop. However in order to provide for his large family, he had to start another small business, transporting school students in his own bus. His wife is a housewife, meaning that Jallal is the only financial resource for the family, since his children are young and are still enrolled in school. 

Jallal decided to contact Al Majmoua and acquire a loan in order to purchase a grill for chicken and other meats and to purchase a barbecue stand. In the future, he wishes to own his own store instead of paying rent to foreigners.

loans.use: to purchase a grill for chicken and other meats and to purchase a barbecue stand

loans.name: Luisa Lavina

texts.es: La señora Luisa es habitante del municipio, junto a sus hijas y esposo lucha dia a dia para salir adelante, doña luisa tien su negocio de venta de ropa y accesorios para dama como Joyas, Carteras etc, con este credito ella invertira un poco mas ya que sus clientas le hacen encargos y ella no quiere perder  aportunidad, para obtener mejores y mayores ingresos, su esposo la apoya ya que trabaja para una empresa privada y sus hijas ya son independientes, Agradece el apoyo que Afodenic y Fondos Kiva le han brindado estos años.
texts.en: Luisa lives in the municipality with her daughters and husband.  She strives daily to get ahead.  Luisa has a business selling clothes and women’s accessories like jewelry, purses, etc.  She will use this loan to invest a bit more because her customers place orders with her and she doesn’t want to lose out on this opportunity to earn better and higher income.  Her husband helps her since he works for a private firm and her daughters are all independent now.  She is grateful for the support Afodenic and Kiva funds have provided her these years.

loans.use: to buy clothes and silver items.

loans.name: Yabom

texts.en:
Meet 45-year-old Yabom from Tombo, in the western rural area in Freetown. She is married and has four children between the ages of 7 and 28. Her children are currently attending school. In 2007, Yabom established her waxed cotton fabric business. She began her business because she needed to generate income to support her family. She works at the business 10 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is  lack of enough capital to run her business.

Yabom requires a loan in order to buy more waxed cotton. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business In the future; Yabom plans to own a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy waxed cotton

loans.name: Ana Lucia

texts.es:
Ana tiene 27 años, está casada con Ángel, un trabajador que es albañil de profesión y tiene su misma edad; con él tiene 2 hijos de 7 y 10 años que están preparándose en una escuela fiscal y a quienes en su tiempo libre ayuda y revisa sus tareas. Ana vive con su esposo e hijos en la ciudad de Latacunga, una de las ciudades más importantes del Ecuador y que está en pleno desarrollo y crecimiento. Su casa está ubicada en la Parroquia Juan Montalvo, un poco alejada de la ciudad. El mayor sueño de ella es poder adquirir un terreno para construir su casa propia.
Ana trabajó desde que era una niña, combinaba su trabajo con los estudios de la escuela primaria, la cual pudo terminar, adquiriendo así los conocimientos básicos que le ayudarían en la administración de su propio negocio. 
Cuando nació el primogénito de Ana, en su hogar había mucha felicidad pero a la vez preocupación, pues los recursos eran escasos y un nuevo miembro de la familia implicaba incrementar los gastos, es en ese momento, que Ana pone en práctica lo que aprendió desde muy niña con su madre y prepara “quimbolitos” para la posterior venta. 
El “quimbolito” es un pastel que está envuelto en hojas de “achira” y se cocina al vapor, preparado con harina de maíz y de trigo, este postre suele servirse con café y muchas familias en el Ecuador lo preparan como comida tradicional. 
Ana invierte entre 8 y 10 horas cada día para la preparación y venta de este producto, aunque en su casa ella tiene un lugar específico en donde van a buscarla sus clientes; Ana también sale a ofrecer sus productos en las áreas comerciales y residenciales de la ciudad para vender la producción diaria. 
Esta mujer innovadora, requiere un préstamo para poder comprar ingredientes con los que prepara los “quimbolitos”, pues por falta de éstos ha habido días que la producción se ha detenido y a pesar de la demanda de sus clientes, Ana no ha podido abastecerse de la cantidad suficiente de ingredientes para preparar el volumen que siempre pone a disponibilidad de sus clientes. 
Ana espera que con este préstamo ella pueda producir mayor cantidad y además tenga en stock los ingredientes necesarios para seguir siempre con la producción, pues además comprando al por mayor ella obtiene mayores descuentos y este ahorro le genera mayores ingresos con los que puede brindar a su familia un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Ana, 27, is married to Ángel who works in construction and is her same age.  She has two children with him who are 7 and 10 years old and are attending public school and who she helps and goes over their homework in her free time.  Ana lives with her husband and children in the city of Latacunga one of Ecuador’s most important cities because it’s in complete development and growth.  Her house is located in Juan Montalvo Parish, a bit distant from the city.  Her greatest dream is to be able to acquire land on which to build her own house.

Ana has worked since she was a girl; she combined work with elementary school studies and was able to complete it acquiring basic skills that would help her manage her own business.

When Ana’s first-born was born her home was full of joy but also with worry because their resources were scarce and the new family member implied increased costs.  It was at that moment that Ana put into practice what she’d learned as a little girl with her mother and started making “quimbolitos” to sell.

A “quimbolito” is a steamed corn and wheat flour cake wrapped in canna leaves; it’s a dessert often served with coffee and many families in Ecuador make it as a traditional dish.

Ana invests between 8 and 10 hours daily making and selling this product; although she has a specific spot at home where customers come looking for her, Ana also goes out to offer her products in commercial and residential areas in the city in order to sell her entire daily production.

She’s very innovating and needs a loan to buy the ingredients used to make “quimbolitos” because the lack of these ingredients has led to days when production has ceased despite customer demand.  Ana’s been unable to stock up on enough ingredients to make the volume she usually has available for her customers.

Ana hopes that with this loan she’ll be able to produce a larger amount and also to have the necessary ingredients in stock so that production can always proceed.  Also, buying at wholesale allows her to access larger discounts and this savings generates higher profits with which she can provide her family with a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy "quimbolito" ingredients at wholesale.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 34 years old and married, with five children who are all school-going. He is into the produce business and agriculture as his major source of income to support the family. 

John buys agricultural produce, mainly maize and beans, to add onto his produce for selling. He also has grazing animals for milking as additional income. John received a loan of one million shillings from Ugafode to buy produce, and he says it worked for him.

John wants another loan of 1,000,000 (one million shillings) to invest in the cereals business, since the season is on. He wants to use the profits from the cereal trade to buy more cows for milking so that his income can increase.

The major challenge John faces is the price fluctuation of cereals, as well as the seasonality in agricultural production.

loans.use: to buy more maize and bean seeds.

loans.name: Victor Eduardo

texts.es:
Victor 44 años de edad es soltero tiene dos hijos que no viven con el, Victor vive con familiares.

Se dedica al comercio de grados como maiz, arveja y frajol, el dinero solicita para la compra de animales de corral como pollos y una lavadora.

El dinero del credito le ayudado a adquirir granos, balanceado, pollos y la lavadora.

El es tener dinero para ampliar el negocio

En los timepos libres le gusta reunirse con los hermanos.
texts.en:
Victor is 44 years old and is unmarried. He has two children who don't live with him. Victor lives with family.

He sells grains such as corn, peas and beans. He is requesting money for the purchase of farmyard animals such as chickens and a washing machine.

The money of the loan helped him to purchase grains, animal feed, chickens and the washing machine.

He has money to grow his business.

In his spare time he likes to get together with his siblings.

loans.use: to buy farmyard animals such as chickens and a washing machine.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
Meet 44-year-old Mamie, from Moribatown in Sierra Leone. She is married, with four children between the ages of 6 and 19 years. Her children are currently attending school. 

In 2008, Mamie established her clothing business. She began her business because she needed to create her own source of income, instead of depending on her husband, alone. She works at the business ten hours per day and seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation.  

Mamie requires a loan in order to purchase more jeans, blouses, and slippers for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and pay her children's school fees. 

In the future, Mamie plans to open a shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more jeans, blouses, and slippers for resale.

loans.name: Maria Dina

texts.es:
Maria es soltera no tiene hijos vive con familiares en San Jose de Chimbo.

Maria se dedica a la agricultura a la simbra de maiz, En credito lo socilita para la comprar de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.

El credito le ayudado ha invertir mejor el dinero en la siembra.

El sueño es tener dinero para salir de viaje en avion.

En los tiempos lobres le gusta salir a caminar.
texts.en:
Maria is unmarried, doesn't have children and lives with family in San Jose de Chimbo.

Maria is a farmer who sows corn. She is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and manure.

The loan helped her to better invest money in the sowing.

Her dream is to have money to go on a plane trip.

In her spare time she likes to go on walks.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and manure.

loans.name: Kefa

texts.en: Kefa is a Kiva borrower who describes himself as determined. He has taken a loan of KES 30,000 to buy a water tank that will benefit five family members.The family faces a challenge of lack of water storage facilities. The tank will enable them to store enough clean water for everyday use. He transports customers using his bicycle, to earn income. He hopes that in future, he will purchase a new motorbike and grow economically.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maria tiene 32 años es soltera tiene un hijo vive con el hijo en San Jose de Chimbo.

Maria trabaja como empleada publica en Echandia a dos horas de Chimbo como Auxiliar de enfermeria el dinero lo solicita la para comprar de un electrodomestico para la casa.

El credito le ayudado a coprar las cosas al contado.

El sueño de Maria es tener siempre salud para estar con el hijo.

Los domingos le gusta reunirse con la familia.
texts.en:
Maria, 32, is single and has one child. They live in San Jose de Chimbo. Maria is a civil servant in Echandia, a city two hours away from Chimbo, and works as a nursing assistant. Maria is asking for a loan to buy a household appliance in cash.
Maria's dream is to always be in good health to be with her son. On Sundays she likes to spend time with her family.

loans.use: to purchase a household appliance

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to re-seed her farms

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
María, vive con su familia. Ella, posee una tienda por lo que desea fortalecer mas su negocio y para ello desea realizar la compra de granos básicos, tales como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, sal y otros;  y de esa manera crece un poco mas económicamente y continuar sacando adelante a su familia.
Con el crédito María lograra mejorar sus ingresos económicos y a la vez  satisfacer las necesidades de otras personas ya que los clientes se encuentran satisfechos con los artículos de primera necesidad que ella les ofrece. 
Su sueño es brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
María lives with her family.  She has a store so she wants to strengthen the business more and to do so needs to buy basic grains like rice, beans, sugar, salt and others.  In this way she’ll grow a bit more economically and continue moving her family forward.

María will succeed in improving her income with the loan and at the same time meet the needs of others because her customers will be satisfied with the basic staples she offers them.  Her dream is to provide better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, salt and others.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand his menu by purchasing a grill, an ice machine, and a fridge

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is a Kiva borrower who describes herself as focused and determined.  She has taken a loan of KES 20,000 to buy a water tank to store clean and sufficient water for use.  Her family faces a challenge of lack of enough storage facilities.  

She owns rental houses, where she gets her income.  She hopes that in the future she will grow economically.  This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio is an artisan from Peru who specializes in sterling silver jewelry. He would like to invest in the purchase of large quantities of silver while the price of silver is more affordable.

Antonio has been selling through NOVICA since 2012. This is his story:

"Ever since I can remember I've always enjoyed painting and designing, so I studied graphic design. However, my wife and her family have been crafting jewelry for generations, and slowly I started designing jewelry. Soon it became my passion. My wife enjoys practicing the techniques her father taught her and eventually we realized it was better to leave the crafting to her, the designing to me. We only get one life to live, and that's why my constant challenge is to succeed every day a little bit more so I can provide a better future for my wife and family."

"Please receive a big hug and my deepest gratitude all the way from Peru. Thank you for being a part of this microcredit."

Use the link below to view Antonio's sterling silver jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/8656

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of large quantities of silver while the price of silver is more affordable

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover gas and maintenance expenses.

loans.name: Jaminatu

texts.en:
Meet 27-year-old Jaminatu, from Waterloo, a western, rural area in Freetown. She is married, with three children between the ages of three and nine years. Two of her children are currently attending school. 

In 2010, Jaminatu established her retail business. She began her business because she needed to create income to support the home. She works at the business 12 hours per day and seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of sufficient capital to run her business.

Jaminatu requires a loan in order to buy a variety of stock, like toothpaste, soap, and cream, to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and to have a permanent business location. 

In the future, Jaminatu plans to expand her business more than ever. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy a variety of stock, like toothpaste, soap, and cream, to expand her business.

loans.name: Rosette

texts.en:
Rosette is married, with four children and only three of them go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. 

She has business of selling charcoal and has been in this for seven years. She has applied for a loan of UGX 600,000 (Uganda shillings) from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO (MCDT SACCO) to buy more bags of charcoal.  

Rosette works in shop seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and also to buy a plot of land on which to build her house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent, feeding the family, and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Ariun-Erdene

texts.en: Ms.Ariun-Erdene is 22 years old lives with her brother in Han-Uul district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her brother Bold-Erdene works at local company and takes care of his sister during her stay in Ulaanbaatar for attending local university for her bachelors. Ariun-Erdene has chosen her major as demography and economics and she is now sophomore student of national university. She is passionate and hardworking student. She is now requesting loan of 1,244,000MNT to pay her tuition fee and obtain good knowledge to invest in her future. She said "I would look for part-time job, if i could not get this loan. This sure will affect my study and academic success"

loans.use: to pay her tuition fee and obtain good knowledge to invest in her future

loans.name: Luis Ramon

texts.es:
Luis tiene 19 años de edad es soltero vive en San Jose de Chimbo con familiares.

Luis trabaja en un almacen de electrodomesticos como cobrador. El credito lo solicita para la compra de una motocicleta que sera de mucho uso para el trabajo.

El credito le ayudado a que el trabajo sea un poco mas comodo ya que tiene que trasladarse a muchos lugares.

El sueño de Luis tener un poco mas dinero y comprar un vehiculo.

En los tiempos libres le gusta hacer deporte con los amigos del barrio.
texts.en:
Luis is 19 years old, is unmarried and lives in San Jose de Chimbo with family.

Luis works in a store selling domestic appliances as a collector. He is requesting a loan for the purchase of a motorbike which will be very useful for his work.

The loan helped make work a little more agreeable for him since he has to travel to many places.

Luis' dream is to have a little more money and to buy a vehicle.

In his spare time he likes to play sports with his friends in the neighborhood.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy fruits to sell for a profit.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a 24-year-old single Palestinian lady, born and living in a Palestinian camp like almost all of the Palestinian refugees living in Lebanon.
Hanan is a hard worker. She puts in so much effort to help her parents make a living. 

In 2008, Hanan opened her small clothes selling shop inside the camp to improve their income and develop their living. She has a wide customer base because of her special customer care, the quality of clothing and the prices.

Hanan is applying for a YOUTH loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua. Hanan will use the loan to increase her merchandise with a special release summer collection, especially as most of her customers and camp citizens prepare themselves for the Holy Ramadan months celebrations, as they buy new clothes for this occasion. Hanan is working hard to move her shop outside the camp or to open an additional branch outside the camp.

loans.use: to increase her merchansise with a special release summer collection

loans.name: David Washington

texts.es:
David tiene 24 años de edad es soltero vivew con los padres en casa de ellos en San Jose de Chimbo.

David trabaja como albañil, el credito lo solicita para la comprar de bienes de consumo como comida enlatada, arroz, azucar y una lavadora 

Con el credito le ayudado a adquirir los productos necesarios.

El sueño es taner dienro para salir de viaje.

En los tiempos libres le gusta salir hacer deporte.
texts.en:
David is 24 years old, unmarried and lives with his parents in their home in San Jose de Chimbo.

David works as a construction worker. He is requesting a loan for the purchase of consumer goods such as canned food, rice, sugar and a washing machine.

The loan helped him to purchase the necessary products.

His dream is to have money to go on a trip.

In his spare time he likes to play sports.

loans.use: to buy canned food, rice, sugar and a washing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a stockyard for the goats

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy necessary furniture accessories requested for a project he is working on and pay the amount left from his wedding expenses

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh is a 33-year-old Lebanese single woman. She has owned a shop in her town where she sells home appliances. She provides her customers with a large variety of products at fair prices. And today, in order to increase her inventory of refrigerators, washers, dryers etc... she is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. She aims to diversify her merchandise selection, as her only purpose is to target wider clientele and be able to gain higher income. 

In the future, Fatmeh looks forward to opening another branch of her shop where she will add other types of products to sell.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of refrigerators, washers, dryers, etc.

loans.name: Mercy Yolanda

texts.es:
Mercy es casada tiene dos hijos vive en San Jose de Chimbo.

Mercy se dedica a la venta de morocho con leche de puerta en puerta. El credito solicita para la comprar de valdes, azucar, leche y morocho ademas de una carpa para el puesto de ventas.

Mercy sueña con tener un local propio para vender el morocho


En los tiempos libres le gusta pasar con la familia.
texts.en:
Mercy is married, has two children and lives in San Jose de Chimbo. She works as a street vendor, selling "morocho" (a kind of dense corn used to prepare thick drinks) with milk door to door.
She is asking for a loan to purchase buckets, sugar, milk and morocho corn, as well as a tent for her selling stand. Mercy dreams of having her own premises to sell the morocho drink.
In her spare time she likes to be with her family.

loans.use: to purchase buckets, sugar, milk, corn and a tent.

loans.name: Antony

texts.en: Antony is a Kiva borrower who describes himself as intelligent and determined. He has taken a loan of KES 20,000 to buy a water tank that will benefit five family members. This will enable them to store enough water for their use. He transports customers using his motorcycle to earn an income. He faces a challenge of competition and bad weather in this business. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM. He hopes that in the future he will grow economically.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Amal

texts.en: Amal is 42 years old and from Gaza. She is married and has two children. She has owned a poultry farm since 2009. She asked Ryada for this loan in order to develop the poultry farm and buy drinking pots, more food, green houses and poultry. With this loan, Amal will be able to increase poultry sales and improve her income.

loans.use: to develop the poultry farm and buy drinking pots, more food, and green houses and poultry.

loans.name: Santos Leonardo

texts.es:
Santos es una persona de 50 años de edad, acompañado y tiene 6 hijos. Es muy conocido en la zona donde vive, se caracteriza por ser un hombre muy trabajador y muy responsable. se dedica a la siembra del maíz esto lo hace desde que tenia 15 años, este conocimiento lo adquirió de su papá; también le trasmitió el conocimiento en la crianza de animales; pero Santos se dedica mas que todo a la agricultura, pues tiene terreno propio que fue dejado por su padre como herencia y hoy en día trabaja en ellas como siempre lo ha realizado.  Sus 6 hijos trabajan en los terreno que tienen; ya que así como lo hizo su padre, él le enseña a sus hijos desde el mas pequeño hasta el mas grande enseñándole la responsabilidad.   

     El señor compra los materiales en dos ciudades que están a 5km y otra a 4km, se traslada en vestía para  comprar los insumos.  que son 25 lbs. De maíz para la siembra, 2 a 3 sacos de formula, insecticida etc.  

     El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 25 libras de semilla de maíz, de 2 a 3 sacos de abono, insecticidas, entre otros insumos  para la siembra de la postrera.

       El préstamo le cambiara su forma de vida ya que el, es el primer crédito que a tenido en toda su vida y así ya tiene una oportunidad en otra necesidad que se le presente a futuro. 

        El señor piensa realizar en el próxima cosecha solicitar un nuevo crédito para comprar un silo para almacenar el grano de maíz.
texts.en:
Santos, 50, is married and has six children.  He's very well known in the area where he lives.  He's known to be a very hardworking and responsible man.

He has earned a living growing corn since he was 15.  He acquired this knowledge from his father.  His father also taught him to raise animals, but Santos works more than anything in agriculture because he has his own plot of land that his father left to him and that now he's working just as has always been done.  His six children work on the land they have because he's teaching his children, from the youngest to the oldest, the responsibility just as his father taught him.

He travels by animal to buy the supplies in two cities, one 5 kilometers away and the other 4 kilometers.  The supplies weigh 25 pounds: corn to plant, 2-3 bags of formula, insecticide, etc.

The loan he's requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy 25 pounds of corn seed, 2-3 bags of soil amendments, insecticide, and other supplies to plant the last crop of the season.

The loan will change his way of life because it's the first loan he has had in his whole life.  This way he has an opportunity for other necessities that may come up in the future.

He plans to request another loan in the next harvest to buy a silo to store his corn seed.

loans.use: to buy corn seed, soil amendments, insecticide, and other supplies

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina is a 47-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. She has seven years of experience in this field.  Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is a mother of nine children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of Rs 45,000 to purchase stock of rice, flour and sugar to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She is in her 6th loan cycle with good repayment history. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase stock of rice, flour and sugar.

loans.name: Tahani

texts.en: Tahani was born in 1978. She is single and lives in Amman, Jordan. Tahani has been working in selling blankets for seven years. She attended a bazaar in Rsaifeh and is planning to increase her merchandise and change it. Now she is requesting a loan to buy more blankets in order to raise her sales and expand her project.

loans.use: to buy more blankets.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Meet 30-year-old Mariama, from Waterloo, a western, rural area in Freetown. She is married, with two children, one and eight years old. One of her children is currently attending school. 

In 2007, Mariama established her wood business. She began her business because she needed to create income to support the home. She works at the business 12 hours per day and seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is a lack of sufficient capital to run her business.

Mariama requires a loan in order to buy wood and charcoal, to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and to have a permanent business location. 

In the future, Mariama plans to own a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy wood and charcoal, to expand her business.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet 44-year-old Fatmata from Waterloo, an eastern area in Freetown. She is married with five children, ages 10 to 25.  

In 2000, Fatmata established her motor oil business. She began her business because she wanted to create a permanent source of income, and she works at the business from 8:00 am until 6:00 pm, Monday to Friday. She says the main challenges to her business are price inflation and transportation difficulties.

Fatmata requires a loan to purchase more items like brake oil and different types of motor oil. She hopes the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and buy a piece of land. 

In the future, Fatmata plans to own the biggest shop in the community. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more items like brake oil and different types of motor oil.

loans.name: Wullamatu

texts.en:
